entry.author: None
entry.headline: Microsoft CEO unveils Windows Phone 7 Series software
entry.body:
Microsoft unveiled the next version of its operating system for mobile phones, Windows Phone 7 Series, featuring a move away from applications and towards functions.

"It's all about the phone and how consumers react to the device," said Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer, opening a news conference held outside the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona on Monday.

Windows Phone 7 Series also marks a move by Microsoft to take greater control of the user interface of its phone software.

"We wanted to take greater accountability for the end user experience," Ballmer said. "We want more consistency in the hardware platform and in the user experience," he said, while nevertheless saying Microsoft wanted to leave room for hardware partners to innovate.

Microsoft also wanted the software to differentiate future phones from its past offerings, both phone and PC.

"Phones looked like PCs, but a phone is not a PC, it's smaller, more personal," said Joe Belfiore, vice president for Windows Phone.

To make the interface more personal, Microsoft is counting on a checkerboard of customizable "live tiles" that can update automatically with information from the phone or the Internet.

Some of the tiles will update automatically to show frequent contacts or local information, while others can be customized manually. The tiles will be grouped into themed "hubs," for example a page of contacts called "people" or a page of photos called "pictures".

Other hubs include "office," which features functions for note-taking and synchronizing documents with a PC; "games," which integrates with the company's Xbox live online community for its game consoles; and "music+video," which synchronizes songs and videos with its desktop Zune jukebox and music store software.

There won't be too much personalization though: some aspects of every Windows Phone will be the same.

"Every Windows Phone 7 Series device will have three buttons on the front: 'Start,' which gives you quick access to those tiles, 'Search,' because that's how you are going to find phone numbers and restaurants, and 'Back,'" said Belfiore.

Belfiore showed how the software will recognize addresses in incoming e-mails or calendar entries, converting them into hotlinks to Microsoft's Bing Maps property.

The interface has an on-screen QWERTY keyboard and will support four-point multitouch interfaces in the same way as Windows 7 for PCs. Another feature borrowed from PCs is the Web browser: it's based on the same code as the desktop version of Internet Explorer, Belfiore said.

The graphics Belfiore showed are spacious, using a thin typeface with big one-word titles for the themes of each screen -- day, local, music and so on. The text is displayed using a more precise version of Cleartype that Belfiore called sub-pixel positioning.

Some of the page transitions in the user interface slide like the cards in Palm's Web OS.

The first version of Windows Phone 7 Series will not include Adobe Flash -- although Ballmer said he had "no objection" to Flash support. That marks the software apart from Apple's iPhone, which does not -- and will not -- support Flash.

Microsoft will also release a software development kit (SDK) to enable network operators and third parties to add new services and applications to the phones. ATT, in the U.S., and Orange, in France, will be among the first operator partners to develop services specially for the phone.

Microsoft expects the first phones running the software to be available by the end of the year, and says that network operators including Deutsche Telekom, Orange, Verizon and Vodafone, and vendors including Samsung, LG, Sony-Ericsson and long-time partner HTC have committed to offering devices running Windows Phone 7 Series.

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Mexico's Televisa, Nextel bid jointly for spectrum
entry.body:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Mexican broadcaster Televisa said on Monday it has jointly bid with new partner Nextel Mexico for wireless capacity in a spectrum auction currently underway in the country.

Alfonso de Angoitia, Televisa's (TV.N) (TLVACPO.MX) executive vice president, told Reuters on Monday that the companies submitted bids for blocks of spectrum in the 1.7 GHz and 1.9 GHz bands.

The auction is one of two government initiatives to boost competition in a market dominated by telecommunications tycoon Carlos Slim. Conditional upon the success of their joint bid, Televisa on Monday said it has offered to buy 30 percent of Nextel Mexico for $1.44 billion.

(Reporting by Cyntia Barrera Diaz)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Televisa in deal to buy NII Mexico stake: report
entry.body:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Broadcaster Televisa has reached a $1.5 billion deal to buy a 30 percent stake in wireless telephone company Nextel Mexico, a unit of NII Holdings NIHD.O, a newspaper said on Monday.

Mexico's government is auctioning wireless spectrum to increase competition in the cellphone market, and Televisa is eager to expand into the industry, which is dominated by billionaire Carlos Slim's America Movil (AMXL.MX) (AMX.N).

Excelsior columnist Dario Celis said the deal, which would include an option to purchase an additional 7.5 percent stake in Nextel Mexico, was reached on Saturday night.

"NII held an extraordinary board meeting Sunday night to vote on the sale," Celis said without mentioning sources. A similar gathering of Televisa's board is expected to take place on Monday, he added.

Televisa (TLVACPO.MX) (TV.N) and Nextel Mexico declined to comment.

Mexico's antitrust regulator gave a green light last week to Televisa's proposal to buy up to 40 percent of NII's Mexican unit, but Televisa said a deal had yet to be reached.

Nextel Mexico is the country's No. 4 wireless operator with nearly 3 million customers. Acquiring a stake in it would let Televisa leap into the cellphone industry without building a network from scratch.

Nextel Mexico focuses on corporate clients and analysts say it generates higher revenue per customer than Iusacell CEL.MX and Spain's Telefonica (TEF.MC), the operators it trails behind.

Partnering with Televisa, a media powerhouse with massive influence in Mexico, would be seen as a powerful boost to Nextel Mexico's sales.

"Televisa would bring a solid marketing background that would propel Nextel's presence across the country," said IXE brokerage in a report.

Acquiring a stake in Nextel Mexico would also let Televisa offer bundled services of fixed-line telephone, wireless, Internet and video.

Televisa's cable companies, including Cablevision (CABLECPO.MX), already sell Internet, television and fixed-line phone services in packages for less than $40 per month under the "YOO" brand. Cable operator Megacable (MEGACPO.MX) teamed with Televisa last year to market similar services.

Nextel Mexico's infrastructure could also help make Televisa's existing telecommunications services more efficient.

Televisa shares rose 0.62 percent to 48.52 pesos on Monday.

(Reporting by Cyntia Barrera Diaz, editing by Gerald E. McCormick)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Microsoft launches mobile software overhaul
entry.body:
BARCELONA (Reuters) - Microsoft launched its new mobile phone operating software on Monday, introducing a range of music, gaming and networking features aimed at expanding its appeal beyond its core business customers.

The world's biggest software company, which is trying to wrest back market share from Apple's iPhone and Research in Motion's BlackBerry, said new phones featuring Windows Phone 7 would be in stores by Christmas.

The overhaul of Microsoft's phone technology, a year later than expected, comes as it hemorrhages market share in the smartphone market, which many see as the key to the future of communication and media.

Microsoft took just an 8.8 percent share of the global smartphone operating systems market last year, according to technology analysis firm Canalys, down from 13.9 percent the year before.

(Reporting by Georgina Prodhan; Editing by Greg Mahlich)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: Matt Cowan
entry.headline: Microsoft CEO mum on iPhone talk
entry.body:
BARCELONA (Reuters) - Microsoft's new mobile software launched on Monday should speak for itself and the company has no current need to buy a mobile device maker or materially change its license fees, its chief executive said.

Steve Ballmer declined to comment on reports Microsoft's new search engine Bing might replace Google on Apple's iPhone, but smiled when asked the question in an interview at the Mobile World Congress trade fair in Barcelona.

Speaking to Reuters as Microsoft launched Phone 7, which it hopes will help it claw back some market share [ID:nLDE61B275], Steve Ballmer said the new software would distinguish Microsoft's smartphones from anything else on the market.

"Look at the user experience around these new phones, and they're really quite different from anything that lives in the smartphone world today," he told Reuters Television on Monday.

The new software is more geared to the leisure aspects of the lives of its core business customers, and includes features of Microsoft's Xbox gaming and Zune music player as well as Microsoft Office and social networking.

But many analysts believe Microsoft needs to make a more radical move, such as buying a hardware maker.

Asked whether Microsoft might ever buy a more fashionable rival, like BlackBerry maker Research in Motion, Ballmer said: "The word 'ever' is a big word but I certainly don't feel like that's the right strategy for us today."

He also said no major change should be expected in the company's policy of charging license fees to handset makers for its mobile software. Microsoft is the only major company to still charge a fee for using its mobile operating system.

"We don't comment generally but there's nothing that interestingly new," he said. Later, he told a news conference: "We plan on staying with the model that we are on."

One potential bright spot in the fortunes of Microsoft's consumer business is the prospect of replacing Google as the default search engine on Apple's iPhone -- a possibility that has been rumored in recent media reports.

When asked about the reports, Ballmer said "I wouldn't comment either way," but smiled, and repeated the phrase when the reporter remarked that Ballmer looked happy.

If Apple displaced Google from its preferred status on the smartphone, it would be perhaps the clearest sign of the growing tension between two Silicon Valley icons that were considered allies in a common cause against Microsoft.

Google's chief mobile engineer, Vic Gundotra, said earlier that Apple was a "very close and valuable partner" and he saw no reason for that to change.

Ballmer also declined to comment on whether the desktop version of Windows might one day run on mobile devices based on ARM chip designs -- a move that could change the dynamics of the burgeoning netbook market.

Currently, ARM designs dominate in smartphones but Intel chips run most notebooks and also the smaller, lower-cost netbooks designed for simple tasks such as Web browsing.

(Reporting by Matt Cowan, writing by Georgina Prodhan; editing by John Stonestreet)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: David Lewis
entry.headline: W. African cocaine use rises along smuggling routes
entry.body:
DAKAR (Reuters) - West Africans are consuming more of the drugs trafficked between South America and Europe, raising the specter of rising crime and health problems in already unstable states, experts said.

The region, an established transit point for Latin American cocaine to big Western markets, has also become a drug processing site amid rising addiction rates, and drug-related violence will follow, they told a drug summit over the weekend.

"A flourishing illicit trade in the hands of organized crime is obviously a threat to the rule of law, governance and, as a result, human rights," said Alexandre Schmidt, West African head for the U.N. Office for Drugs and Crime (UNODC).

"But we must no longer hide the indirect consequences with regard to the increase in problems linked to drug abuse."

Some 20 tones of cocaine passed through West Africa in 2008, worth about $1 billion, the United Nations says.

The warnings came during a meeting of seven West African governments who, backed by the United Nations, France and Spain, are seeking to implement declarations of intent to curb trafficking.

ALARMING TRENDS

The drugs trade through West Africa grabbed headlines in 2007 after a series of seizures of hundreds of kg of cocaine were made in the region alongside a spike up in violence.

Guinea-Bissau, the landing point for most of the cocaine, saw a string of political assassinations that analysts say was linked to the drugs trade, and the notoriously brutal military in neighboring Guinea was also believed to be involved.

But now West African nations are sounding the alarm over new trends of increased domestic drug use that could boost theft, gang violence, and health problems.

"We are also increasingly becoming consumers of the drugs we transit," Adrienne Diop, a commissioner for regional body ECOWAS, said in a presentation made on her behalf.

Although concrete figures are hard to come by, experts said there was clear evidence of a rise in local use of cocaine and crack. Citing research in Cape Verde, the region's initial drug hot-spot, Margarete Molnar, a health specialist at UNODC, said drug use was entrenched.

"This shows that being on the route of trafficking is a disaster," she said. "(Law enforcement) may protect West Africa and Europe but I can tell you that in this region there are people who are hard drug users who need to be rehabilitated."

A string of local health workers attending the summit also called for an increased focus on rehabilitating existing drug users instead of a purely law-enforcement approach to stamping down on the international trade.

"Strategies have not been thought of for the youth," said Aissatou Thiam an educator in Senegal's Ministry for Youth and Sport. "They need to come up with plans to tackle the issues of the youth, who are turning to drugs because of poverty, amongst other issues."

(Editing by Richard Valdmanis)

entry.headline: Best Buy to Bring 15 Teens to Coca-Cola International Soccer Camp through the @15 Soccer Camp Sweepstakes
entry.body: Winners will also attend a soccer match and experience the beauty of South Africa MINNEAPOLIS--(Business Wire)-- Best Buy Co., Inc. today announced the launch of the @15 Soccer Camp Sweepstakes, an online sweepstakes that will send 15 teens to Pretoria, South Africa from June 15-20. Best Buy is the only US retail partner in that will be selecting teens to participate in the 2010 Coca-Cola International Soccer Camp in South Africa. Teens participating in the Coca-Cola International Soccer Camp will have the opportunity to attend a FIFA World Cup match. Through @15, Best Buy`s philanthropic platform that focuses on teens` strengths and giving voice to teens` perspectives to create social change, Best Buy is partnering with Coca-Cola to provide a unique opportunity for the winners to participate in the Coca-Cola International Soccer Camp. "The @15 Soccer Camp Sweepstakes is an exciting opportunity to ignite teen sparks," said Paula Prahl, Senior Vice President, Communications, Public Affairs and Corporate Responsibility for Best Buy Co., Inc. "Not only are we proud to provide the trip of a lifetime for 15 lucky teens, but Best Buy is also giving them the opportunity to further develop their passion, and give back to a community in need." The online entry process is only available to teen members of www.at15.com. Membership of www.at15.com is free. Entrants must be between the ages of 13 and 16, English speaking and be legal residents of the United States, including Washington, D.C. and Puerto Rico. In order to enter, teens take the SparkFinder survey - a digital tool that helps teens identify their interests and talents - and complete the official entry form. Boys and girls 13-16 years are encourage to visit www.at15.com to become a member of @15, take the SparkFinder survey and submit an online entry form for the @15 Soccer Camp Sweepstakes. The deadline for entries is March 15, 2010. Winners will be selected in a random drawing from all eligible entries received. Winners will be announced on or about March 17, 2010 on www.at15.com. There will be 15 grand prize trip winners and another 15 first place prize winners who each will receive a $100 Best Buy gift card. Teens can enter once daily for a chance to win. No purchase is necessary to enter or win. The sweepstakes is subject to the Official Rules, available at www.at15.com. About @15 Best Buy believes in the power of teens, and @15 is a new platform to connect with them, give voice to their perspectives, and invest our resources-including the energy and talents of our employees-to turn their ideas into action and support their efforts to lead social change. Teens bring passion and enthusiasm to tackling tough issues. They are also important to our business-they shop in our stores, and they're our future employees. There`s a real opportunity to listen to and learn from what teens have to say. And through the @15 Fund, we'll put the philanthropic power of @15 directly into their hands. To learn more, visit www.at15.com. About Best Buy Co., Inc. With operations in the United States, Canada, China, Europe and Mexico, Best Buy is a multinational retailer of technology and entertainment products and services with a commitment to growth and innovation. The Best Buy family of brands and partnerships collectively generates more than $45 billion annual revenue and includes brands such as Best Buy, Audiovisions, The Carphone Warehouse, Future Shop, Geek Squad, Jiangsu Five Star, Magnolia Audio Video, Napster, Pacific Sales Kitchen, Bath and Electronic Centers, The Phone House and Speakeasy. Approximately 155,000 employees apply their talents to help bring the benefits of these brands to life for customers through retail locations, multiple call centers and Web sites, in-home solutions, product delivery and activities in our communities. Community partnership is central to the way we do business at Best Buy. In fiscal 2009, we donated a combined $33.4 million to improve the vitality of the communities where our employees and customers live and work. For more information about Best Buy, visit www.bestbuy.com. Best Buy Erin Gunderson, 612-291-7286 erin.gunderson@bestbuy.com or Weber Shandwick Kendall Murphy, 202-585-2163 kmurphy@webershandwick.com Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Mobile Fair-UPDATE 1-Microsoft revamps flagging phone offering
entry.body:
* Windows 7 phones to be in stores by Christmas

* New software comes a year later than expected

* Microsoft mobile market share fell to 9 pct in 2009

By Georgina Prodhan and Bill Rigby

BARCELONA/SEATTLE, Feb 15 (Reuters) - Microsoft (MSFT.O) launched a long-awaited revamp of its mobile phone software on Monday, aimed at reviving the flagging fortunes of the world's biggest software maker in the mobile world.

Microsoft, trying to claw back market share from Apple's (AAPL.O) iPhone and Research in Motion's RIM.TO BlackBerry, said Windows Phone 7 would cater for all aspects of the lives of businesspeople, including social networking, games and music.

Microsoft took just 8.8 percent share of the global smartphone operating system market last year, according to technology analysis firm Canalys, down from 13.9 percent the year before.

It trails Symbian, which runs on Nokia (NOK1V.HE) phones, RIM's BlackBerry and Apple's iPhone. It is even in danger of being caught by Google's (GOOG.O) new Android system, which already has 4.7 percent share of the market.

Microsoft's core customers have remained firmly rooted in the business world, while rivals have broadened their appeal to younger buyers as prices fell. Microsoft is also the only major phone software maker to charge a licence fee to handset makers.

Handset makers such as HTC (2498.TW), Samsung (005930.KS) and Motorola MOT.N all make Windows phones but are increasingly turning to Android, which is not only free but attracting a fast-growing developer community.

Speaking to Reuters Television, Chief Executive Steve Ballmer said Phone 7 was not aimed specifically at consumers but rather at business people who also had a life. [ID:nLDE61E197]

"We're really trying to go after the life market. People work, they live, and I think on their phone they don't make a big distinction, so we need to support all aspects of somebody's life," Ballmer said.

The update comes after a lukewarm reception for Windows Mobile 6.5 in October, which most analysts viewed as a poor competitor in the fast-developing market.

Aside from users of Windows operating systems, Microsoft's consumer business is modest. Its entertainment and devices unit posted a profit of $169 million last fiscal year, a fraction of the almost $11 billion profit from its Windows franchise. (Reporting by Georgina Prodhan and Bill Rigby; Editing by David Cowell)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: C.H. Robinson Worldwide to Participate in the Raymond James Institutional Investors Conference and the J.P. Morgan Aviation, Transportation & Defense Conference
entry.body: EDEN PRAIRIE, Minn.--(Business Wire)-- C.H. Robinson Worldwide, Inc. (Nasdaq: CHRW) will deliver company presentations at two upcoming investor conferences: the J.P. Morgan Aviation, Transportation & Defense Conference on Tuesday, March 9, 2010, and the Raymond James Institutional Investors Conference on Wednesday, March 10, 2010. The C.H. Robinson presentation at the J.P. Morgan conference will be at 10:15 a.m. Eastern Time on Tuesday, March 9. The J.P. Morgan conference will be held at the J.P. Morgan Conference Center in New York City. The C.H. Robinson presentation at the Raymond James conference will be at 8:05 a.m. Eastern Time on Wednesday, March 10. The Raymond James conference will be held at the JW Marriott Grande Lakes in Orlando, Florida. Live audio webcasts of both presentations will be available via the Internet at www.chrobinson.com, in the Investors section. Replay of the webcasts will be available for one month following the live presentations. For more information about the presentations or webcasts, please contact C.H. Robinson`s Investor Relations Department at 952-937-7847 or email angie.freeman@chrobinson.com. Founded in 1905, C.H. Robinson Worldwide, Inc., is a global provider of multimodal transportation services and logistics solutions, serving over 35,000 customers through a network of 235 offices in North America, South America, Europe, Asia, Australia, and the Middle East. C.H. Robinson is one of the largest third-party logistics companies in the world, with 2009 total revenues of $7.6 billion. For more information about our company, visit our Web site at www.chrobinson.com. C.H. Robinson Worldwide, Inc. Angie Freeman, 952-937-7847 Vice President of Investor Relations Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Televisa in deal to buy NII Mexico stake - paper
entry.body:
MEXICO CITY Feb 15 (Reuters) - Broadcaster Televisa has reached a deal to buy a 30 percent stake in wireless telephone company Nextel Mexico, a unit of NII Holdings NIHD.O, Excelsior newspaper said on Monday.

The paper's columnist Dario Celis said the $1.5 billion deal, which will include an option to purchase an additional 7.5 percent stake in Nextel Mexico, was reached Saturday night.

"NII held an extraordinary board meeting Sunday night to vote on the sale," Celis said without mentioning sources. A similar gathering of Televisa's board is expected to take place Monday morning, he added.

Televisa (TLVACPO.MX) (TV.N) and NII were not available for comment.

Mexico's antitrust regulator gave a green light last week to Televisa's proposal to buy up to 40 percent of NII's Mexican unit.

Televisa is eager to expand into cell phone services, tapping the market dominated by billionaire Carlos Slim. Nextel Mexico is the No. 4 player in Mexico's wireless market but analysts say it generates higher revenue per customer than its two closest competitors. (Reporting by Cyntia Barrera Diaz; Editing by Theodore d'Afflisio)

entry.headline: Recession, What Recession? Aldata / IBM Retail CIO Survey Shows Increased IT Spending and Focus on Optimizing Processes for Fast ROI
entry.body: ATLANTA--(Business Wire)-- Aldata Solution, a leading provider of software solutions for the retail industry, today released findings from the second annual Global Retail CIO Survey, jointly sponsored with IBM. The survey showed that IT budgets appear to be recovering after the initial downturn at the start of last year`s recession, with averages for all retailers at 1.3% of sales compared to 1% last year. Twenty-six percent of respondents expect their IT budget to increase; the same figure as last year. However, while last year`s survey showed that increase to relate to projects already underway, this year`s interviews revealed more aggressive plans to implement new systems. The survey of 109 retail CIOs and IT Directors in both the Americas and Europe was undertaken in Q4 2009 by retail industry research specialists Martec International. This year`s Global Retail CIO Survey clearly shows that optimizing the product / place / promotion offer is becoming an increasingly critical element of retail IT spend. More than 50% of retailers will be upgrading, replacing or implementing new systems in areas such as Automated Replenishment (52%), Assortment Optimization (58%), Promotions Optimization (56%), Promotions Management (54%), with a further 46% looking to invest in Demand Forecasting. Master Data Management (MDM) has the highest planned implementation of all applications studied in the survey, both across the Enterprise (35%) and for Supplier Management (28%). "The top line statistics from this year`s survey, and indeed last year`s, suggest that the retail sector has survived the recession remarkably effectively," said Allan Davies, CMO, Aldata Solution. "The truth is, though, that while the downturn hasn`t halted retailers` IT spend, it has certainly changed the way that money is spent. Gone are the days of end-to-end, rip and replace projects, and instead we`re seeing a big focus on process optimization. Retail CIOs are not afraid of investing in new projects, but they need to see a quick return on investment. And by quick, I`m talking about months, not years." Customer is King Systems to attract and keep customers featured prominently in this year`s survey. Multi-channel CRM was ranked as the most important application by respondents, with 42% having yet to implement multi-channel CRM, but with plans to do so within the next three years. Similarly 38% of CIOs surveyed plan to implement Loyalty systems - with customer data linked to buying patterns and behavior - within the next three years. And finally, systems that support the safety of customers were considered the most important application by 47% of respondents. Sustainability Not a Priority For the first time, attitudes to sustainability were considered as part of the research. Respondents were asked to score the impact of sustainability on IT spend and strategy on a scale of 1 to 10 (with 10 being the highest). The average emerged as a lukewarm 5.1. Views appeared to be polarized, with 13% considering sustainability to have a negligible impact on IT strategy, while 6% considered it to have a major impact. In terms of which applications retailers feel are having the greatest impact on sustainability, applications for store operations came top of the list. For the future, more retailers believe that multi-channel retailing will have the biggest impact on sustainability. Methodology The Aldata-IBM Global Retail CIO Survey was conducted by retail industry research specialists Martec International to assist retailers in benchmarking their IT strategy and use of technology against their peers. The 2010 Global Retail CIO Survey incorporates the views of retailers from 28 countries generating at least $100 million in annual revenue, whose combined sales represent $528 billion from more than 62,000 stores. This equates to 8 percent of the total retail market in the Americas and Europe by sales. A total of 109 CIOs and IT directors in category-management-style retailers were interviewed for this report. Participants included a mix of both food and non-food retailers from across North America and Europe. The survey provides insights into current retail IT spending plans and priorities. The survey can be downloaded at www.aldata-solution.com. Aldata 100% Retail-Wholesale Aldata is a global leader in the supply of integrated business solutions to organizations that serve the retail consumer and wholesale distribution markets. Aldata has an unparalleled 20-year track record of delivering targeted software projects that substantially improve our customers` businesses, from supplier to shopper. Today, Aldata customers include 15 of the World`s 30 largest retailers, thousands of retail brands, and hundreds of national and regional chains. More at: www.aldata-solution.com About IBM For more information about IBM, visit http://www.ibm.com/services. Martec International Over the last 20 years, Martec has become the leading firm of retail business process experts in the world. It is also the world leader in training and consulting services for companies that sell to retailers. For more information, visit http://www.martec-international.com/index.htm. Schwartz Communications Avi Dines or Anne Lundregan, 781-684-0770 aldata@schwartz-pr.com Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.headline: Goldman Sachs economist sees China revaluing yuan
entry.body:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - China could be about to allow its currency to strengthen by as much as 5 percent to slow down the country's fast-growing economy, Goldman Sachs' (GS.N) chief economist was quoted as saying on Sunday.

"I have a strong opinion that they're close to moving the exchange rate," Jim O'Neill told Bloomberg. "Something's brewing. It could happen anytime."

The news service said O'Neill believes China may allow the yuan to rise as much as 5 percent in a one-time revaluation and to then trade within a bigger band or against a larger basket of currencies.

"They need to do something to slow the economy down and deal with the inflation consequences," he was quoted as saying. O'Neill believes China's economy is growing between 12 percent and 14 percent, Bloomberg said.

The World Bank has forecast China's economy will grow 9 percent this year, faster than global growth of 2.7 percent. Beijing said it expanded by 8.7 percent in 2009.

(Reporting by Steve James; Editing by Richard Chang)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Mobile Fair-Microsoft launches mobile software overhaul
entry.body:
BARCELONA Feb 15 (Reuters) - Microsoft (MSFT.O) launched its new mobile phone operating software on Monday, introducing a range of music, gaming and networking features aimed at expanding its appeal beyond its core business customers.

The world's biggest software company, which is trying to wrest back market share from Apple's (AAPL.O) iPhone and Research in Motion's RIM.TO BlackBerry, said new phones featuring Windows Phone 7 would be in stores by Christmas.

The overhaul of Microsoft's phone technology, a year later than expected, comes as it haemorrhages market share in the smartphone market, which many see as the key to the future of communication and media.

Microsoft took just an 8.8 percent share of the global smartphone operating systems market last year, according to technology analysis firm Canalys, down from 13.9 percent the year before. (Reporting by Georgina Prodhan; Editing by Greg Mahlich)

entry.headline: Libya suspends issuing visas to Europeans
entry.body:
TRIPOLI (Reuters) - Libya has suspended the issuing of entry visas to European citizens apart from British nationals, an official at the country's main international airport said on Monday.

Asked by Reuters to confirm reports of the move, the official, who did not want to be identified, said: "This is right. This decision has been taken. No visas for Europeans, except Britain."

No explanation was given for the suspension, and there was no immediate confirmation from the Libyan government.

Italy's foreign ministry confirmed the measure and said it was in retaliation for Switzerland's recent decision to publish a blacklist of 180 Libyans banned from entering the country.

Libya has been locked for months in a diplomatic row with Switzerland over the prosecution of two Swiss businessmen who had been working in the North African country.

"The Libyan response to the Swiss decision has affected all the countries of the Schengen zone," said a spokesman for the Italian foreign ministry. "Contacts are under way between the countries of the zone to coordinate over this measure."

Libya's Oea newspaper, which has close ties to a son of Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi, earlier reported that Libya would stop issuing visas to citizens of countries in the Schengen area, which includes non-EU member Switzerland.

(Reporting by Ali Shuaib; Writing by Christian Lowe; Editing by Mark Trevelyan)

entry.headline: Libya suspends entry visas for EU-airport source
entry.body:
TRIPOLI Feb 15 (Reuters) - Libya has suspended the issuing of entry visas to citizens of all European Union states except Britain, an official at the country's main international airport said on Monday.

Asked by Reuters to confirm reports about the visa suspension, the official, who did not want to be identified, said: "This is right. This decision has been taken. No visas for Europeans, except Britain." (Reporting by Ali Shuaib; Writing by Christian Lowe; Editing by Louise Ireland)

entry.headline: Visa et DeviceFidelity collaborent pour accélérer l`adoption des paiements sans contact via mobile
entry.body: L`alliance vise à transformer les téléphones portables en dispositifs mobiles de paiement Visa BARCELONE, Espagne--(Business Wire)-- Visa Inc. (NYSE : V), le plus grand réseau du monde de paiement électronique de détail1, et DeviceFidelity Inc. ont annoncé aujourd`hui leur projet de commercialiser une solution innovatrice grâce à laquelle il sera possible d`utiliser un téléphone portable doté d`un emplacement pour carte mémoire comme dispositif mobile de paiement Visa. La solution allie la technologie de paiement sans contact de Visa, Visa payWave, à la technologie In2PayTM de DeviceFidelity pour transformer un téléphone portable doté d`un emplacement pour mémoire microSD en dispositif mobile de paiement sans contact. Ceci peut donner la possibilité aux consommateurs d`effectuer des transactions Visa payWave via mobile chez tous les commerçants qui acceptent les paiements sans contact. Les essais devraient débuter au deuxième trimestre 2010. Cette collaboration s`inscrit dans la stratégie mobile de Visa visant à étendre la portée de son réseau international pour apporter les paiements via mobile et les services connexes aux consommateurs du monde entier. Avec plus de 4 milliards d`appareils portables sur le marché à l`heure actuelle, Visa, en partenariat avec des institutions financières, des exploitants de réseaux mobiles et des fabricants de combinés, s`attache à faire bénéficier les consommateurs du monde entier des avantages des services financiers via mobile. « L`objectif de Visa est de développer des moyens innovants d`apporter l`avantage de la monnaie numérique Visa aux utilisateurs d`appareils mobiles du monde entier », a indiqué Dave Wentker, responsable du service des paiements sans contact via mobile chez Visa Inc. « Par le biais de sa collaboration avec DeviceFidelity, Visa contribue à accélérer l`adoption des paiements sans contact via mobile et à ouvrir la voie au déploiement à l`échelle internationale des appareils équipés de la technologie NFC. » Le réseau de traitement de transactions mondiales de Visa, VisaNet, et sa technologie de paiement sans contact jouent un rôle essentiel dans le traitement sécurisé des transactions effectuées avec la solution In2Pay, offrant la surveillance en temps réel des fraudes et une technologie du chiffrement qui travaillent de concert pour éviter les faux et assurer que les transactions Visa effectuées via mobile soient tout aussi sûres que tous les paiements Visa. « Nous sommes déterminés à aider le secteur à réaliser le plein potentiel du téléphone portable et à fournir une nouvelle offre de paiement par connexion sans fil qui est plus rapide, plus sûre et plus pratique que les modes classiques de paiement électronique », a expliqué pour sa part Deepak Jain, PDG de DeviceFidelity. « Nous sommes enthousiastes à l`idée de travailler avec Visa, la marque numéro un dans le domaine des paiements, pour que les paiements via mobile deviennent réalité dans les pays du monde entier. » La solution In2Pay, qui est conforme à la norme du secteur en ce qui concerne les puces mémoires et microSD, s`emboîte dans l`emplacement pour carte mémoire dont sont équipés de nombreux appareils mobiles commercialisés actuellement. In2Pay s`intègre de façon homogène avec de multiples systèmes d`exploitation de téléphones portables, autorisant ainsi une interface d`application souple et l`interactivité avec le consommateur. In2Pay utilise une antenne embarquée commandée par logiciel et une puce de carte intelligente sans contact à double interface conforme à la norme du secteur qui prend en charge Visa payWave, ainsi que d`autres applications sans contact populaires auprès des consommateurs, comme le contrôle de transit, d`identification et d`accès. Outre DeviceFidelity, Visa travaille également avec des fournisseurs de technologie clés et des partenaires d`alliance stratégique pour tester et déployer cette technologie innovatrice de paiement sans contact via mobile, dont CPI Card Group, Inside Contactless, Monitise plc et NXP Semiconductors. 1 Sur la base du volume de paiements, du volume total, du nombre de transactions et du nombre total de cartes en circulation. À propos de Visa Visa est une société internationale de technologie de paiement qui relie des consommateurs, des entreprises, des institutions financières et des administrations dans plus de 200 pays et territoires à de la monnaie numérique rapide, sûre et fiable. Soutenant la monnaie numérique, l`un des réseaux de traitement les plus avancés du monde, VisaNet est capable de traiter plus de 10 000 transactions à la seconde, offrant une protection contre les fraudes aux consommateurs et la garantie des paiements aux commerçants. Visa n`est pas une banque, n`émet pas de cartes, n`accorde pas de crédit aux consommateurs et ne fixe ni les taux ni les commissions. Les innovations de Visa, toutefois, permettent aux institutions financières qui sont ses clientes d`offrir plus de choix aux consommateurs : payer maintenant par carte de débit, payer en avance avec une carte prépayée ou payer plus tard grâce au crédit. Pour plus de renseignements, consultez www.corporate.visa.com. À propos de DeviceFidelity, Inc. DeviceFidelity, Inc. développe des technologies plug-and-play grâce auxquelles diverses institutions peuvent déployer leurs services et applications sur les téléphones portables actuels et futurs dans le monde entier. Ayant pour mission d`apporter l`innovation de la technologie sans contact au téléphone portable, la société détient de nombreux brevets en instance auprès du bureau américain des brevets comme auprès de bureaux des brevets internationaux. DeviceFidelity est une entreprise privée sise à Richardson au Texas avec des bureaux à Foster City en Californie. Pour plus d`informations, rendez-vous sur www.devicefidelity.com. Le texte du communiqué issu d`une traduction ne doit d`aucune manière être considéré comme officiel. La seule version du communiqué qui fasse foi est celle du communiqué dans sa langue d`origine. La traduction devra toujours être confrontée au texte source, qui fera jurisprudence. Pour plus d`informations, presse uniquement : Visa Inc. Elvira Swanson, 650-504-4537 globalmedia@visa.com Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.headline: Visa and DeviceFidelity Collaborate to Accelerate Adoption of Mobile Contactless Payments
entry.body: Alliance seeks to transform mobile phones into Visa mobile payment devices BARCELONA, Spain--(Business Wire)-- Visa Inc. (NYSE: V), the world`s largest retail electronic payments network1, and DeviceFidelity Inc. today announced plans to market an innovative solution that can enable a mobile phone with a memory card slot to be used as a Visa mobile payment device. The solution combines Visa`s contactless payment technology, Visa payWave, and DeviceFidelity`s In2PayTM technology to transform a mobile phone with a microSD memory slot into a mobile contactless payment device. This can enable consumers to make mobile Visa payWave transactions at any retail location that accepts contactless payments. Trials are scheduled to begin in the second quarter of 2010. This collaboration aligns with Visa`s mobile strategy to extend the reach of its global network to bring mobile payments and related services to consumers around the globe. With more than 4 billion mobile devices in market today, Visa, in partnership with financial institutions, mobile network operators and handset manufacturers, is working to deliver the benefits of mobile financial services to consumers worldwide. "Visa`s goal is to develop innovative ways to bring the value of Visa digital currency to mobile users around the globe," said Dave Wentker, Head of Mobile Contactless Payments at Visa Inc. "Through our collaboration with DeviceFidelity, Visa is helping to accelerate the adoption of mobile contactless payments and pave the way for the global deployment of NFC-enabled devices." Visa`s global transactions processing network, VisaNet, and its contactless payment technology play a critical role in securely processing transactions initiated with the In2Pay solution, providing real-time fraud monitoring and encryption technology that work in concert to prevent counterfeit fraud and ensure that mobile initiated Visa transactions are as secure as all Visa payments. "We`re committed to helping the industry unlock the true promise of the mobile phone and deliver a new wirelessly connected payment offering that is faster, more secure, and more convenient than traditional forms of electronic payment," said Deepak Jain, CEO of DeviceFidelity. "We are excited to be working with Visa, the leading brand in payments, to make mobile payments a reality in countries around the globe." The In2Pay solution conforms to the industry standard for memory chips, microSD, and fits into the memory card slot found in many existing mobile devices in market today. In2Pay integrates seamlessly with multiple mobile phone operating systems, enabling a flexible application interface and interactivity with the consumer. In2Pay uses an onboard software controlled antenna and an industry standard dual interface contactless smart card chip that supports Visa payWave, as well as other contactless applications popular with consumers such as transit, identification and access control. In addition to DeviceFidelity, Visa is also working with key technology providers and strategic alliance partners to test and deploy this innovative mobile contactless payment technology, including CPI Card Group, Inside Contactless, Monitise plc, and NXP Semiconductors. 1 Based on payments volume, total volume, number of transactions and total number of cards in circulation. About Visa Visa is a global payments technology company that connects consumers, businesses, financial institutions and governments in more than 200 countries and territories to fast, secure and reliable digital currency. Underpinning digital currency is one of the world`s most advanced processing networks-VisaNet-that is capable of handling more than 10,000 transactions a second, with fraud protection for consumers and guaranteed payment for merchants. Visa is not a bank, and does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers. Visa`s innovations, however, enable its financial institution customers to offer consumers more choices: Pay now with debit, ahead of time with prepaid or later with credit products. For more information, visit www.corporate.visa.com. About DeviceFidelity, Inc. DeviceFidelity, Inc. develops plug-and-play technologies that empower a variety of institutions to deploy their services and applications on existing and upcoming mobile phones worldwide. Committed to bringing contactless innovation to the mobile phone, the company has numerous patents pending in both U.S. and international patent offices. DeviceFidelity is a private corporation with headquarters in Richardson, Texas and offices in Foster City, California. For more information, go to www.devicefidelity.com. For more information, press only: Visa Inc. Elvira Swanson, 650-504-4537 globalmedia@visa.com Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.headline: Visa e DeviceFidelity colaboram para acelerar a adoção de pagamentos móveis sem contato
entry.body: A aliança busca transformar celulares em dispositivos de pagamento móvel Visa BARCELONA, Espanha--(Business Wire)-- A Visa Inc. (NYSE: V), maior rede de pagamentos eletrônicos no varejo1 do mundo, e a DeviceFidelity Inc. anunciaram hoje planos de comercializar uma solução inovadora que pode habilitar telefones celulares com entrada para cartão de memória para uso como dispositivos móveis de pagamento Visa. A solução combina a tecnologia de pagamento sem contato Visa payWave com a tecnologia In2PayTM, da DeviceFidelity, para transformar qualquer telefone celular com entrada para cartão de memória microSD em dispositivo de pagamento móvel sem contato. Isso pode permitir que os consumidores façam transações Visa payWave móveis em qualquer loja de varejo que aceite pagamentos sem contato. O início dos testes está agendado para o segundo trimestre de 2010. Essa colaboração está alinhada com a estratégia móvel da Visa para ampliar o alcance da sua rede global e levar pagamentos móveis e serviços correlatos para consumidores de todo o mundo. Com mais de quatro bilhões de dispositivos móveis no mercado hoje, a Visa, em parceria com instituições financeiras, operadoras de redes móveis e fabricantes de dispositivos portáteis, está trabalhando para oferecer os benefícios dos serviços financeiros móveis para consumidores de todo o mundo. "A meta da Visa é desenvolver formas inovadoras de levar o valor da moeda digital Visa para usuários móveis de todo o mundo", disse Dave Wentker, chefe de pagamentos móveis sem contato da Visa Inc. "Por meio da colaboração com a DeviceFidelity, a Visa está ajudando a acelerar a adoção dos pagamentos móveis sem contato e a abrir caminho para a implantação global dos dispositivos habilitados para NFC." A VisaNet, rede global de processamento de transações da Visa, e sua tecnologia de pagamento sem contato têm papel fundamental no processamento seguro de transações iniciado com a solução In2Pay. Oferecem tecnologias de criptografia e monitoramento de fraude em tempo real que funcionam em conjunto para evitar fraude por falsificação e garantir que as transações móveis Visa iniciadas sejam tão seguras quanto todos os pagamentos Visa. "Temos o compromisso de ajudar o setor a cumprir a verdadeira promessa do telefone celular e produzir uma nova oferta de pagamento com conexão sem fio que seja mais rápido e mais seguro, além de proporcionar mais conveniência do que as formas tradicionais de pagamento eletrônico", disse Deepak Jain, diretor executivo da DeviceFidelity. "Estamos entusiasmados por estar trabalhando com a Visa, a marca líder em pagamentos, para tornar os pagamentos móveis uma realidade em todos os países do mundo." A solução In2Pay está em conformidade com os chips de memória microSD, que são o padrão da indústria, e se encaixa na entrada do cartão de memória de vários dispositivos móveis já existentes no mercado. O In2Pay se integra perfeitamente a vários sistemas operacionais de telefonia celular, permitindo interface de aplicação flexível e interatividade com o consumidor. O In2Pay usa uma antena controlada por software integrado e um chip de smart card sem contato de dupla interface, padrão do setor, compatível com o Visa payWave, além de outras aplicações sem contato bem conhecidas dos consumidores, como trânsito, identificação e controle de acesso. Além da DeviceFidelity, a Visa está trabalhando também com outros importantes fornecedores de tecnologia e parceiros estratégicos para testar e implantar essa inovadora tecnologia de pagamento móvel sem contato, como CPI Card Group, Inside Contactless, Monitise plc e NXP Semiconductors. 1 Baseado em volume de pagamentos, volume total, número de transações e número total de cartões em circulação. Sobre a Visa A Visa é uma empresa global de tecnologia de pagamentos que, em mais de duzentos países e territórios, conecta consumidores, empresas, instituições financeiras e governos a uma moeda digital confiável, segura e rápida. A moeda digital tem o apoio da VisaNet, uma das mais avançadas redes de processamento do mundo, capaz de manusear mais de dez mil transações por segundo, com proteção contra fraude para os consumidores e pagamento garantido para os comerciantes. A Visa não é um banco e não emite cartões, não estende crédito nem estabelece taxas e índices para consumidores. As inovações da Visa, no entanto, permitem que as instituições financeiras clientes ofereçam aos consumidores um número maior de opções: pagar na hora, com débito; antecipadamente, com cartão pré-pago; ou depois, com produtos de crédito. Para obter mais informações, visitewww.corporate.visa.com. Sobre a DeviceFidelity, Inc. A DeviceFidelity, Inc. desenvolve tecnologias plug-and-play que permitem a um grande número de instituições implantar seus serviços e aplicações em telefones celulares atuais e futuros, em todo o mundo. Com o compromisso de levar a inovação sem contato para o telefone celular, a empresa tem várias patentes em processo de registro em órgãos de patentes dos EUA e internacionais. A DeviceFidelity é uma empresa de capital fechado com sede em Richardson, Texas, e escritórios em Foster City, Califórnia. Para obter mais informações, acesse www.devicefidelity.com. O texto no idioma original deste anúncio é a versão oficial autorizada. entry.author: None
entry.headline: Visa y DeviceFidelity trabajan conjuntamente para acelerar la adopción de pagos móviles sin contacto
entry.body: Alianza buscar transformar los teléfonos celulares en dispositivos para el pago móvil de Visa BARCELONA, España--(Business Wire)-- Visa Inc. (NYSE: V), la red de pagos electrónicos minorista más grande del mundo1, y DeviceFidelity Inc. anunciaron hoy planes para comercializar una solución innovadora que puede permitir el uso de un teléfono celular con ranura para tarjeta de memoria como dispositivo de pago móvil de Visa. La solución combina la tecnología de pago sin contacto de Visa, Visa payWave, y la tecnología In2PayTM de DeviceFidelity para transformar un teléfono celular con ranura para tarjeta de memoria microSD en un dispositivo de pago móvil sin contacto. Esto podrá permitir a los consumidores realizar transacciones móviles de Visa payWave en cualquier lugar minorista que acepte pagos sin contacto. Las pruebas están programadas para comenzar en el segundo trimestre de 2010. Esta colaboración va de mano con la estrategia móvil de Visa para extender el alcance de su red global y ofrecer pagos móviles y servicios relacionados a los consumidores de todo el mundo. Con más de 4.000 millones de teléfonos celulares en el mercado a la fecha, Visa, en alianza con instituciones financieras, los operadores de redes móviles y fabricantes de teléfonos celulares, está trabajando para ofrecer los beneficios de los servicios financieros móviles a los consumidores en todo el mundo. "La meta de Visa es desarrollar formas innovadoras para ofrecer el valor de la moneda digital de Visa a los usuarios de teléfonos celulares en todo el planeta", afirmó Dave Wentker, director de pagos móviles sin contacto de Visa Inc. "A través de nuestra colaboración con DeviceFidelity, Visa ayuda a acelerar la adopción de los pagos móviles sin contacto y allana el camino para el desarrollo global de los dispositivos habilitados para la tecnología NFC". La red global de procesamiento de transacciones de Visa, VisaNet y su tecnología de pago sin contacto juegan un rol importante en el procesamiento seguro de transacciones iniciadas con la solución In2Pay, proporcionando un monitoreo por fraude en tiempo real y una tecnología de encriptación que funcionan de manera conjunta para evitar falsificación de tarjetas y asegurar que las transacciones móviles de Visa que se inicien sean tan seguras como todos los pagos de Visa. "Estamos comprometidos a ayudar a la industria a sacar partido de la verdadera promesa del teléfono móvil y a ofrecer una nueva oferta de pago inalámbrico que sea más rápida, más segura y más conveniente que las formas tradicionales de pago electrónico", manifestó Deepak Jain, director ejecutivo de DeviceFidelity. "Estamos entusiasmados de estar trabajando con Visa, la marca líder en pagos, para que se hagan realidad los pagos móviles en países en todo el mundo". La solución in2Pay cumple con los estándares industriales para chips de memoria, microSD, y se adapta a la ranura de tarjeta de memoria encontrada en los dispositivos celulares existentes en el mercado actual. In2Pay se integra de forma homogénea con múltiples sistemas de operación de telefonía celular, permitiendo una interfase de aplicación flexible e interactividad con el consumidor. In2Pay utiliza una antena controlada de software integrado y un chip de tarjeta inteligente sin contacto de interfase dual que cumple con los estándares de la industria y que soporta Visa payWave, así como otras aplicaciones sin contacto populares entre los consumidores tales como el control de acceso, de identificación y de tránsito. Además de DeviceFidelity, Visa también trabaja con proveedores clave de tecnología y socios de alianza estratégica para probar y desplegar esta innovadora tecnología de pago móvil sin contacto, incluyendo a CPI Card Group, Inside Contactless, Monitise plc y NXP Semiconductors. 1 Teniendo en cuenta el volumen de pagos, el volumen total, el número de transacciones y el número total de tarjetas en circulación. Acerca de Visa Visa es una compañía mundial de tecnología de pago que conecta a los consumidores, comercios, instituciones financieras y gubernamentales en más de 200 países y territorios con una moneda digital confiable, segura y rápida. Con soporte de la moneda digital se encuentra una de las redes de procesamiento más avanzadas del mundo, VisaNet, capaz de manejar más de 10.000 transacciones por segundo, protegiendo a los consumidores contra fraude y garantizando el pago a los comerciantes. Visa no es un banco y no emite tarjetas, no extiende créditos ni fija precios ni honorarios a los consumidores. Las innovaciones de Visa, no obstante, permiten que sus clientes de instituciones financieras ofrezcan a los consumidores más opciones: Pague ahora sus productos con débito, por anticipado con prepago o más tarde con crédito. Para obtener más información, visite www.corporate.visa.com. Acerca de DeviceFidelity, Inc. DeviceFidelity, Inc. desarrolla tecnologías plug and play (conectar y usar) que permiten a una variedad de instituciones instalar sus servicios y aplicaciones en los teléfonos celulares existentes y en los teléfonos celulares disponibles más adelante en todo el mundo. Comprometidos a brindar la innovación de la tecnología sin contacto para la telefonía celular, la compañía tiene numerosas patentes pendientes tanto en los Estados Unidos como en las oficinas de patentes internacionales. DeviceFidelity es una sociedad privada con sede en Richardson, Texas y con oficinas en Foster City, California. Para obtener más información, visite www.devicefidelity.com. El texto original en el idioma fuente de este comunicado es la versión oficial autorizada. entry.author: None
entry.headline: Visa und DeviceFidelity arbeiten zur schnelleren Einführung kontaktloser Zahlungsmöglichkeiten über Mobiltelefone zusammen
entry.body: Bündnis zur Umwandlung von Mobiltelefonen in mobile Visa-Zahlungsgeräte BARCELONA, Spanien--(Business Wire)-- Visa Inc. (NYSE: V), das weltweit größte elektronische Zahlungsnetzwerk für den Einzelhandel,1 und DeviceFidelity Inc. haben heute Pläne zur Markteinführung einer innovativen Lösung bekannt gegeben, durch die Mobiltelefone mit Speicherkartenschlitz als mobile Visa-Zahlungsgeräte genutzt werden können. Die Lösung verbindet die kontaktlose Zahlungstechnologie Visa payWave mit der Technologie In2PayTM von DeviceFidelity, wodurch Mobiltelefone mit microSD-Speicherschlitz in kontaktlose mobile Zahlungsgeräte umgewandelt werden können. Dadurch können Verbraucher an jedem Standort, der kontaktlose Bezahlungen akzeptiert, Transaktionen über Visa payWave tätigen. Erste Versuche sind für den Beginn des zweiten Quartals 2010 vorgesehen. Diese Zusammenarbeit steht in Einklang mit der Mobilgerätestrategie von Visa, wodurch die Reichweite des globalen Netzwerks auf Zahlungen über Mobilgeräte und verwandte Dienstleistungen für Verbraucher rund um die Welt ausgedehnt werden soll. Da sich heute über vier Milliarden Mobiltelefone auf dem Markt befinden, arbeitet Visa zusammen mit Finanzinstituten, Mobilfunkbetreibern und Handyherstellern an der Einführung vorteilhafter mobiler Finanzdienstleistungen für Verbraucher auf der ganzen Welt. „Ziel von Visa ist die Entwicklung innovativer Möglichkeiten, Handynutzern rund um die Welt den Wert der elektronischen Zahlungen mit Visa näher zu bringen", sagte Dave Wentker, Leiter der Abteilung Mobile Contactless Payments bei Visa Inc. „Unsere Zusammenarbeit mit DeviceFidelity hilft Visa bei der Beschleunigung der Einführung kontaktloser Zahlungsmöglichkeiten über Mobiltelefone und ebnet den Weg für den globalen Einsatz von NFC-fähigen Geräten." Das globale Netzwerk VisaNet zur Verarbeitung von Transaktionen und die Technologie von Visa zur kontaktlosen Bezahlung spielen eine entscheidende Rolle bei der sicheren Verarbeitung von Transaktionen, die mit der Lösung In2Pay ausgelöst werden, denn sie bieten Echtzeitbetrugsüberwachung und Verschlüsselungstechnologien, die gemeinsam betrügerische Fälschungsversuche verhindern und sicherstellen, dass die über ein Mobiltelefon ausgelösten Visa-Transaktionen so sicher sind wie alle anderen Zahlungsmöglichkeiten mit Visa. „Wir setzen uns zusammen mit der Branche dafür ein, dass das wahre Versprechen von Mobiltelefonen eingelöst und ein neues Zahlungsangebot über drahtlose Verbindungen eingeführt wird, das schneller, sicherer und bequemer ist als herkömmliche Formen des bargeldlosen Bezahlens", sagte Deepak Jain, CEO von DeviceFidelity. „Wir freuen uns, zusammen mit Visa, dem Branchenführer bei Zahlungsmethoden, an der Verwirklichung mobiler Zahlungsmöglichkeiten in Ländern rund um die Welt zu arbeiten." Die Lösung In2Pay entspricht der Speicherchip-Industrienorm microSD und passt in den Speicherkartenschlitz von vielen Mobilgeräten auf dem heutigen Markt. In2Pay kann nahtlos in mehrere Betriebssysteme von Mobiltelefonen integriert werden, wodurch eine flexible Anwendungsschnittstelle und Interaktivität mit dem Verbraucher ermöglicht werden. In2Pay enthält eine eingebaute, softwaregesteuerte Antenne und einen der Industrienorm entsprechenden Dual-Interface-Smartcard-Chip für kontaktlose Anwendungen, der Visa payWave sowie andere beliebte Anwendungen für den Verkehrsbereich sowie für Identifikationen und Zugangskontrollen unterstützt. Neben DeviceFidelity arbeitet Visa auch mit anderen wichtigen Technologieanbietern und strategischen Bündnispartnern zusammen, um diese innovative kontaktlose Zahlungstechnologie über Mobilgeräte zu testen und einzuführen. Dazu zählen die CPI Card Group, Inside Contactless, Monitise plc und NXP Semiconductors. 1 Gestützt auf Zahlungsvolumen, Gesamtvolumen, Anzahl Transaktionen und Gesamtanzahl von Karten im Umlauf. Über Visa Visa ist ein im Zahlungsverkehr tätiges globales Technologieunternehmen, das Verbrauchern, Geschäften, Finanzinstituten und Behörden in über 200 Ländern und Gebieten schnell, sicher und zuverlässig Zugang zu elektronischem Geld gibt. Untermauert wird dieser Zugang durch VisaNet, eines der fortschrittlichsten Verarbeitungsnetzwerke der Welt. VisaNet kann über 10.000 Transaktionen pro Sekunde bewältigen, schützt Verbraucher vor Betrugsfällen und garantiert Händlern den Zahlungseingang. Visa ist keine Bank, stellt keine Karten aus, gewährt keine Verlängerungen der Zahlungsfrist und legt auch keine Tarife und Gebühren für Verbraucher fest. Die Innovationen von Visa machen es jedoch möglich, dass Finanzinstitute ihren Kunden eine größere Produktauswahl bieten können: Zahlungen können gleich mit Debit-, zum Voraus mit Prepaid- oder im Nachhinein mit Kreditprodukten erledigt werden. Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter www.corporate.visa.com. Über DeviceFidelity, Inc. DeviceFidelity, Inc., entwickelt sofort betriebsbereite Technologien, die verschiedenen Institutionen den Einsatz von Dienstleistungen und Anwendungen über bestehende und neue Mobiltelefone auf der ganzen Welt erlauben. Das Unternehmen, dessen Engagement der Bereitstellung von kontaktlosen Innovationen für Mobiltelefone gilt, hat sowohl beim Patentamt in den USA als auch in diversen anderen Ländern zahlreiche Patente angemeldet. DeviceFidelity ist ein Privatunternehmen mit Hauptsitz in Richardson, Texas, sowie einer Niederlassung in Foster City, Kalifornien. Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter www.devicefidelity.com. entry.author: None
entry.headline: J.P. Morgan adquirirá ativos da RBS Sempra Commodities
entry.body: Nova Iorque--(Business Wire)-- A J.P. Morgan anunciou hoje que adquirirá os ativos de petróleo global, metais globais e gás e energia da Europa da RBS Sempra Commodities. A transação deve ser fechada no segundo trimestre de 2010, com aprovações regulatórias pendentes. Esses ativos serão integrados à empresa existente Global Commodities da J.P. Morgan, liderada por Blythe Masters. A RBS Sempra Commodities manterá as empresas de energia, gás natural e soluções da América do Norte. A Sempra Energy e a RBS continuarão a explorar opções estratégicas para as empresas restantes. A Sempra Energy manteve a J.P. Morgan como sua consultoria financeira para revisar alternativas em potencial. A J.P. Morgan espera pagar $ 1.7 bilhões, sujeitos a distribuições antes do fechamento. Os ativos serão comprados em dinheiro, todos a serem pagos no fechamento, e espera-se que contribuam com lucro imediatamente no fechamento. "Isso quase dobra o número de clientes corporativos que a nossa franquia de Commodities pode atender e nos capacita a oferecê-los mais produtos em mais regiões do mundo", disse Jes Staley, CEO do Banco de Investimentos. "Isso permitirá que sejamos mais úteis aos clientes nas formas que são importantes para eles". "Nós estamos satisfeitos em receber os talentosos funcionários da RBS Sempra Commodities na J.P. Morgan", disse Blythe Masters, Diretor da Global Commodities. "As habilidades e os relacionamentos que eles trazem farão de nossa empresa de Commodities uma líder global de verdade no atendimento aos clientes". Sobre a J.P. Morgan A J.P. Morgan é a divisão de banco de investimentos da JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM), uma empresa líder em serviços financeiros globais com ativos de $ 2 trilhões e operações em mais de 60 países. A JPMorgan Chase é líder em atividades de banco de investimentos, serviços financeiros para consumidores, pequenas empresas e bancos comerciais, processamento de transações financeiras, gerenciamento de ativos e participações privadas. A empresa atende a milhões de consumidores nos Estados Unidos e a muitas das mais proeminentes corporações do mundo, clientes institucionais e governamentais sob suas marcas J.P. Morgan e Chase. Informações sobre a J.P. Morgan está disponível no endereço www.jpmorgan.com. O texto no idioma original deste anúncio é a versão oficial autorizada. As traduções são fornecidas apenas como uma facilidade e devem se referir ao texto no idioma original, que é a única versão do texto que tem efeito legal. J.P. Morgan Mídia: Kristin Lemkau, 212-270-7454 kristin.lemkau@jpmorgan.com ou Investidor: Lauren Tyler, 212-270-8205 lauren.m.tyler@jpmorgan.com Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.author: None
entry.headline: J.P. Morgan adquirirá activos exclusivos de RBS Sempra Commodities
entry.body: NUEVA YORK--(Business Wire)-- J.P. Morgan anunció hoy que adquirirá los activos globales de petróleo, metales y energía y de petróleo europeos de RBS Sempra Commodities. Se espera cerrar la transacción en el segundo trimestre de 2010; todavía se encuentran pendientes las aprobaciones regulatorias. Estos activos estarán integrados en el negocio actual de Commodities Globales de J.P. Morgan liderado por Blythe Masters. RBS Sempra Commodities mantendrá sus negocios de gas natural y energía y Soluciones de América del Norte. Sempra Energy y RBS continuarán analizando opciones estratégicas para los negocios que se mantienen. Sempra Energy continuará con J.P. Morgan como asesor financiero para revisar las potenciales alternativas. Se espera que J.P. Morgan pague $ 1.700 millones sujetos a distribuciones antes del cierre. Los activos serán adquiridos en efectivo, todos pagaderos al cierre, y se espera que se conviertan en una ganancia inmediatamente después del cierre. "Esto prácticamente duplica la cantidad de clientes corporativos que nuestra franquicia de Commodities puede atender y nos permite ofrecerles más productos en más regiones del mundo", comentó Jes Staley, CEO de Investment Bank. "Esto nos permitirá ser más útiles a nuestros clientes de una manera más eficiente". "Nos complace presentar a los talentosos empleados de RBS Sempra Commodities a J.P. Morgan," indicó Blythe Masters, jefe de Commodities Globales. "Las habilidades y relaciones que aporten transformarán nuestro negocio de Commodities en un verdadero líder mundial en atención a clientes". Acerca de J.P. Morgan J.P. Morgan es el brazo bancario de inversiones de JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM), firma mundial líder en servicios financieros con activos de $2.000 billones y operaciones en más de 60 países. JPMorgan Chase es líder en servicios bancarios de inversión y financieros para consumidores, banca comercial y de pequeñas empresas, procesamiento de transacciones financieras, gestión de activos y capital privado. La firma atiende a millones de consumidores en Estados Unidos y muchos de los clientes corporativos, institucionales y gubernamentales más prominentes del mundo bajo las marcas de J.P. Morgan y Chase. Más información acerca de J.P. Morgan se encuentra disponible en www.jpmorgan.com. El texto original en el idioma fuente de este comunicado es la versión oficial autorizada. Las traducciones solo se suministran como adaptación y deben cotejarse con el texto en el idioma fuente, que es la única versión del texto que tendrá un efecto legal. J.P. entry.author: None
entry.headline: J.P. Morgan erwirbt bestimmte Assets von RBS Sempra Commodities
entry.body: NEW YORK--(Business Wire)-- Wie J.P. Morgan heute mitteilte, wird die Bank die globalen Öl-, Metall- und die europäischen Strom- und Erdgas-Assets von RBS Sempra Commodities erwerben. Die Transaktion wird voraussichtlich im zweiten Quartal 2010 mit allen notwendigen offiziellen Genehmigungen abgeschlossen. Die betreffenden Assets werden in das bestehende Global Commodities Geschäft von J.P. Morgan integriert, das von Blythe Masters geleitet wird. RBS Sempra Commodities wird seine nordamerikanischen Erdgas- und Strom- sowie Solutions-Geschäftsbereiche behalten. Sempra Energy und RBS werden weiterhin nach strategischen Optionen für die übrigen Geschäftsbereiche forschen. Sempra Energy hat J.P. Morgan als seinen Finanzberater für die Prüfung potenzieller Alternativen behalten. J.P. Morgan wird voraussichtlich 1,7 Mrd US$ vorbehaltlich von Verrechnungen vor Abschluss zahlen. Die Assets werden in bar gekauft und sind alle bei Abschluss der Transaktion zahlbar. Voraussichtlich werden sie sofort nach Abschluss der Transaktion zu einem Gewinn beitragen. „Die Transaktion verdoppelt die Anzahl der Unternehmenskunden, die unsere Commodities Franchise betreuen kann, und versetzt uns in die Lage, ihnen mehr Produkte in mehr Regionen der Welt anzubieten," so Jes Staley, CEO der Investment Bank „Wir werden dadurch unseren Kunden von größerem Nutzen sein, und zwar auf eine Weise, die wichtig für sie ist." „Wir sind erfreut, die talentierten Mitarbeiter von RBS Sempra Commodities bei J.P. Morgan willkommen zu heißen," so Blythe Masters, Leiterin von Global Commodities. „Die Fertigkeiten und das Können sowie die Beziehungen, die sie einbringen, machen unser Commodities-Geschäft bei der Betreuung von Kunden weltweit führend." Über J.P. Morgan J.P. Morgan ist der Investment-Banking-Arm von JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM), ein weltweit führendes Finanzdienstleistungsunternehmen mit Assets in Höhe von 2,0 Billionen US$ und Niederlassungen in mehr als 60 Ländern. JPMorgan Chase ist führend im Investment-Banking, bei Finanzdienstleistungen für Verbraucher, Mittelstand-Banking, Commercial-Banking, bei Transaktions-Serviceleistungen, Vermögensverwaltung und Private Equity. Die Bank betreut unter ihren Markennamen J.P. Morgan und Chase Millionen von Verbrauchern in den USA und viele der weltweit prominentesten Unternehmenskunden, institutionellen Kunden sowie staatlichen Auftraggebern. Informationen über J.P. Morgan erhalten Sie unter www.jpmorgan.com. Die Ausgangssprache, in der der Originaltext veröffentlicht wird, ist die offizielle und autorisierte Version. entry.author: None
entry.headline: Mexico's Televisa offers to interchange notes
entry.body:
MEXICO CITY Feb 16 (Reuters) - Mexican broadcaster Televisa said on Tuesday it launched an offer to exchange $600 million in senior notes issued last year that were not registered under the U.S. Securities Act of 1933.

Televisa said in a stock market filing it would exchange the debt for senior notes registered under the securities act, with the same interest payments and maturity.

Televisa issued the 30-year bonds last November for liability management and general corporate uses. (Reporting by Noel Randewich; Editing by Valerie Lee)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Goldman, Greece failed to disclose swap -report
entry.body:
NEW YORK Feb 16 (Reuters) - Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) arranged a currency swap for Greece that it failed to disclose and that allowed the country, now facing a debt crisis, to hide the extent of its deficit, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday.

The Wall Street bank managed $15 billion of bond sales for the European country after arranging the swap, Bloomberg reported, citing a review of the prospectuses.

No mention of the swap was made in sales documents for the securities in at least six of the 10 sales Goldman arranged for Greece since the deal, the report said. It added the bank helped Greece raise $1 billion of off-balance-sheet funding in 2002 through the swap.

A Goldman spokesman was not immediately available to comment.

Greece has required a political pledge of support from the European Union as fears over its debt sparked a market attack that has dented the euro and lifted bond yields. [ID:nLDE61F0XT] (Reporting by Jonathan Spicer; Editing by Bernard Orr)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Australia's Coca-Cola Amatil worried on economy
entry.body:
MELBOURNE Feb 17 (Reuters) - Coca-Cola Amatil Ltd (CCL.AX), Australia's top soft drinks bottler, said on Wednesday it was concerned about a slow economic recovery in Australia in 2010.

Managing Director Terry Davis made the comments in a briefing, adding that the threat of higher official interest rates would do nothing to help consumer confidence. (Reporting by Victoria Thieberger; editing by Balazs Koranyi)
