entry.headline: Yahoo! e Microsoft vão implementar aliança no segmento de busca
entry.body: Conclusão da análise na Europa e nos EUA abre caminho para avanço do acordo SUNNYVALE, Califórnia, e REDMOND, Washington--(Business Wire)-- A Microsoft (Nasdaq:MSFT) e a Yahoo! (Nasdaq:YHOO) anunciaram hoje que seu acordo no segmento de busca foi aprovado, sem restrições, pelo Departamento de Justiça dos EUA e pela Comissão Europeia e que vão agora voltar sua atenção para o início do processo de implementação do negócio. A implementação do negócio deve ter início nos próximos dias e vai envolver a transição das plataformas de busca pagas e algorítmicas da Yahoo! para a Microsoft, com a Yahoo! tornando-se a força de vendas de relacionamento exclusiva dos anunciantes premium em mecanismos de busca das duas empresas. Quando a transição for concluída, o mercado de busca unificado das empresas vai oferecer mais inovação para os consumidores, maior volume e eficiências para os anunciantes e melhores oportunidades de monetização para os editores da Internet, por meio de uma plataforma com um conjunto maior de consultas de busca. "Esta revolucionária aliança no segmento de busca significa que a Yahoo! pode se concentrar até mais em nossa inovadora experiência em busca", disse a diretora executiva da Yahoo!, Carol Bartz. "A Yahoo! tem de fazer o que faz de melhor: combinar nossa ciência e tecnologia com conteúdo atraente para criar experiências on-line pessoalmente relevantes para nossos usuários e clientes." O diretor executivo da Microsoft, Steve Ballmer, concorda com a avaliação de Bartz. "Apesar de estarmos apenas no início desse processo, alcançamos um marco estimulante", disse Ballmer. "Acredito que, juntas, a Microsoft e a Yahoo! vão promover mais escolha, mais valor e mais inovação para os clientes, anunciantes e editores." Experiência de busca do consumidor De acordo com os termos do acordo, que foi anunciado no final de julho de 2009, a Microsoft vai fornecer à Yahoo! as mesmas listagens de resultados de busca disponível através do Bing, e a Yahoo! vai inovar essas listagens integrando conteúdo Yahoo! rico, listagens aprimoradas com informação convenientemente organizada sobre tópicos essenciais e ferramentas para oferecer uma experiência sob medida para os usuários do site Yahoo! A Yahoo! vai se concentrar na oferta de uma experiência de busca inovadora e empolgante, que permita às pessoas encontrar e conhecer melhor as coisas, pessoas e sites que mais importam para elas. Apesar de a Microsoft fornecer a plataforma subjacente, as duas empresas continuarão a criar experiências diferentes, evolutivas e instigantes, concorrendo por público, engajamento e cliques. Cronograma da transição A Yahoo! e a Microsoft vão trabalhar com anunciantes, editores e desenvolvedores num plano sob medida, desenhado para tornar a transição o mais eficiente e contínua possível. As duas empresas começarão a trabalhar com a maioria dos parceiros antes da planejada transição para a plataforma Microsoft e, periodicamente, levarão aos parceiros todas as informações importantes sobre a transição, por telefone, e-mail, seminários pela Internet e no recém-criado site www.searchalliance.com. As empresas vão começar a transição da busca algorítmica e estabeleceram a meta de completar essa iniciativa, pelo menos nos Estados Unidos, até o final de 2010. As empresas esperam também avançar significativamente na transição de anunciantes e editores dos EUA antes das festas de fim de ano de 2010, mas podem esperar até 2011, se entenderem que a transição será mais eficaz depois daquele período. Todos os clientes e parceiros globais devem ter feito a transição até o início de 2012. Relações com o cliente Uma vez feita a transição, a Yahoo! e a Microsoft vão representar e oferecer apoio para diferentes segmentos de anunciantes. A equipe de vendas da Yahoo! vai representar e apoiar, com exclusividade, os anunciantes com alto volume de anúncios, as agências de otimização para mecanismos de busca (SEO) e marketing de busca (SEM) e os revendedores e seus clientes. A Microsoft vai representar e apoiar os anunciantes de autosserviço. Resumo regulatório Apesar de a transação ter sido anteriormente aprovada por autoridades reguladoras na Austrália, no Brasil e no Canadá, os termos do acordo exigiam aprovação nos EUA e na Europa antes do início de sua efetivação. A Microsoft e a Yahoo! continuam a trabalhar com as autoridades reguladoras da Coreia, de Taiwan e Japão para garantir que tenham todas as informações necessárias para avaliar a transação antes de seu início efetivo nessas jurisdições específicas. Sobre a Microsoft Fundada em 1975, a Microsoft (Nasdaq:MSFT) é a empresa líder mundial em software, serviços e soluções que ajudam as pessoas e as empresas a realizar seu potencial. Nota para os editores: se estiverem interessados em encontrar mais informações sobre a Microsoft, visitem a página internet da Microsoft em http://www.microsoft.com/presspass nas páginas de informações corporativas sobre a Microsoft. Links, números de telefones e cargos estavam corretos no momento da publicação, mas podem ter sido alterados desde então. Para obter ajuda, jornalistas e analistas podem entrar em contato com a equipe de resposta rápida da Microsoft, ou outros contatos adequados, listados em http://www.microsoft.com/presspass/contactpr.mspx. Sobre a Yahoo! A Yahoo! atrai centenas de milhões de usuários todos os meses através de sua tecnologia inovadora e conteúdo e serviços atraentes, que fazem de seu site um dos destinos de Internet com maior tráfego e da Yahoo! uma empresa de mídia on-line de categoria internacional. A visão da Yahoo! é ser o centro das vidas das pessoas no ambiente on-line, por meio da oferta de experiências de Internet pessoalmente significativas e relevantes. A Yahoo! tem sede em Sunnyvale, Califórnia. Para obter mais informações, visite pressroom.yahoo.com ou o blog da empresa, Yodel Anecdotal (yodel.yahoo.com). Este comunicado à imprensa contém declarações prospectivas sobre riscos e incertezas relativos ao acordo de busca da Yahoo! com a Microsoft. Os riscos e incertezas potenciais incluem, entre outros, os benefícios esperados do acordo com a Microsoft, que podem não se concretizar, e a resposta ou aceitação do acordo por editores, anunciantes, usuários e funcionários e pelos parceiros de negócios e parceiros estratégicos da Yahoo! Yahoo! é marca registrada e/ou nome comercial registrado da Yahoo! Inc.Todos os demais nomes são marcas registradas e/ou nomes comerciais registrados dos seus respectivos titulares. entry.headline: Yahoo! et Microsoft vont mettre en œuvre leur alliance de recherche sur Internet
entry.body: Après examen, les autorités américaines et européennes entérinent l`accord qui peut ainsi passer à la phase suivante SUNNYVALE, Californie et REDMOND, Washington--(Business Wire)-- Microsoft (Nasdaq : MSFT) et Yahoo! (Nasdaq : YHOO) ont annoncé aujourd`hui avoir reçu les autorisations, sans restrictions, concernant leur accord de recherche sur Internet, du Ministère de la justice américain et de la Commission européenne, et que les deux sociétés allaient à présent porter leur attention sur la mise en route du processus de mise en œuvre de la transaction. La mise en œuvre de la transaction, qui devrait débuter dans les prochains jours, comportera le passage des plates-formes algorithmiques et de recherche sponsorisée de Yahoo! à Microsoft, Yahoo! devenant l`intermédiaire exclusif des deux sociétés pour la commercialisation de la publicité contextuelle premium auprès des annonceurs au niveau mondial. Une fois la transition achevée, le marché unifié de recherche sur Internet des sociétés offrira une innovation améliorée aux internautes, de meilleurs volumes et une plus grande efficacité aux annonceurs et de meilleures opportunités de monétisation aux éditeurs Web, grâce à une plateforme qui contient un pool plus vaste de requêtes d`interrogation. « Cette alliance de recherche révolutionnaire signifie que Yahoo! peut focaliser son attention encore plus sur sa propre expérience de recherche sur Internet novatrice », a déclaré Carol Bartz, la PDG de Yahoo!. « Yahoo! a la possibilité de se concentrer sur ce qu`elle fait le mieux, à savoir allier son expertise scientifique et technologique à des contenus captivants afin de développer des expériences en ligne pertinentes sur le plan personnel pour ses utilisateurs et clients. » Le PDG de Microsoft, Steve Ballmer, est d`accord avec Mme Bartz sur ce point. « Bien que nous ne soyons qu`au début de ce processus, nous avons atteint un formidable jalon », a confié M. Ballmer. « Je crois qu`ensemble, Microsoft et Yahoo! vont promouvoir un choix plus important, une meilleure valeur et une plus grande innovation auprès de leurs clients, des annonceurs et des éditeurs. » Expérience de l`internaute de la recherche sur Internet En vertu des termes de l`accord, lequel a été annoncé fin juillet 2009, Microsoft fournira à Yahoo! les mêmes listes de résultats de recherche disponibles via Bing, et Yahoo! innovera autour de ces listes en y intégrant du contenu Yahoo! enrichi, des listes améliorées d`informations organisées de façon pratique sur des sujets clés, et des outils permettant aux utilisateurs de Yahoo! de personnaliser leur expérience. Yahoo! s`attachera à offrir une expérience de recherche sur Internet innovante et captivante permettant aux internautes de trouver et d`explorer les choses, les personnes et les sites qui ont le plus d`importance pour eux. Alors que Microsoft fournira la plateforme sous-jacente, les deux sociétés continueront à créer des expériences différentes passionnantes et évolutives, restant concurrentes pour ce qui est du public, de l`engagement et du nombre de clics. Calendrier de la transition Yahoo! et Microsoft vont collaborer avec des annonceurs, des éditeurs et des développeurs à l`élaboration d`un plan personnalisé destiné à rendre la transition aussi efficiente et aussi transparente que possible. Les deux sociétés commenceront à travailler étroitement avec la plupart des partenaires bien avant leur transition prévue vers la plateforme Microsoft, et leur communiqueront périodiquement des informations importantes au sujet de la transition via téléphone, courriels, webinaires et un site Internet nouvellement créé :www.searchalliance.com. Les sociétés vont commencer la transition de la recherche algorithmique et ont fixé comme objectif de terminer cette phase d`ici fin 2010, du moins pour ce qui est des États-Unis. Elles espèrent par ailleurs réaliser d`importants progrès au niveau de la transition des annonceurs et éditeurs aux États-Unis avant la période des fêtes 2010, mais pourront éventuellement attendre 2011 si elles jugent que la transition sera plus efficace après les fêtes. La transition de tous les clients et partenaires à l`échelle mondiale devrait être terminée d`ici à début 2012. Relations clients Une fois la transition en place, Yahoo! et Microsoft représenteront chacune différents segments d`annonceurs auxquels elles fourniront un support client. L`équipe de vente de Yahoo! représentera et fournira le support client exclusivement aux annonceurs à gros volume, aux agences SEO et SEM et aux revendeurs et à leurs clients. Microsoft représentera et fournira le support client aux annonceurs en self-service. Résumé sur les autorisations réglementaires Bien que la transaction ait déjà reçu l`accord des instances réglementaires en Australie, au Brésil et au Canada, les termes de l`accord nécessitaient l`autorisation des autorités américaines et européennes avant que celui-ci ne puisse commencer. Entre-temps, Microsoft et Yahoo! continuent à travailler avec les instances réglementaires coréennes, taïwanaises et japonaises pour s`assurer que celles-ci soient bien en possession de toutes les informations dont elles ont besoin pour évaluer la transaction avant que cette dernière ne commence dans ces juridictions en question. À propos de Microsoft Fondée en 1975, Microsoft (Nasdaq : MSFT) est le leader mondial des logiciels, des services et des solutions qui aident les particuliers ainsi que les entreprises à réaliser leur plein potentiel. Note à l`intention des rédacteurs : si vous souhaitez voir des informations complémentaires sur Microsoft, veuillez consulter la page Web de Microsoft à l`adresse http://www.microsoft.com/presspass sur les pages d`informations sur l`entreprise de Microsoft. Les liens Web, numéros de téléphone et titres étaient exacts à la date de publication, mais ils peuvent avoir changé depuis lors. Pour toute assistance supplémentaire, les journalistes et analystes peuvent contacter l`équipe Microsoft Rapid Response Team ou d`autres contacts appropriés listés sur http://www.microsoft.com/presspass/contactpr.mspx. À propos de Yahoo! Yahoo!, qui attire des millions d`internautes tous les mois grâce à sa technologie innovante et des services et contenus incontournables, est l`une des destinations sur Internet les plus visitées et une société de médias en ligne de calibre international. La vision de Yahoo! est d`être au centre de la vie en ligne des internautes en leur offrant des expériences Internet profondes et pertinentes sur le plan personnel. Yahoo! est basée à Sunnyvale en Californie. Pour de plus amples informations, consultez pressroom.yahoo.com ou le blog de la société, Yodel Anecdotal (yodel.yahoo.com). Le présent communiqué de presse contient des déclarations prévisionnelles concernant les risques et incertitudes quant à l`accord de recherche de Yahoo! avec Microsoft. Les risques et incertitudes potentiels comprennent, entre autres, l`éventualité que les avantages attendus de l`accord avec Microsoft ne soient pas réalisés, et la réponse ou l`acceptation de l`accord par les éditeurs, annonceurs, internautes et salariés et par les partenaires stratégiques et commerciaux de Yahoo!. Yahoo! est la marque de commerce et/ou la marque déposée de Yahoo! Inc.Tous les autres noms sont des marques de commerce et/ou des marques déposées de leurs détenteurs respectifs. Galerie photos/multimédia disponible sur :http://www.businesswire.com/cgi-bin/mmg.cgi?eid=6184785=fr Le texte du communiqué issu d`une traduction ne doit d`aucune manière être considéré comme officiel. La seule version du communiqué qui fasse foi est celle du communiqué dans sa langue d`origine. La traduction devra toujours être confrontée au texte source, qui fera jurisprudence. Yahoo! Kim Rubey, 408-349-4040 krubey@yahoo-inc.com ou Microsoft (The Glover Park Group) Ben Hammer, 202-295-0143 bhammer@gpgdc.com Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.headline: Yahoo! y Microsoft implementan alianza de sistemas de búsqueda
entry.body: La finalización de las revisiones estadounidenses y europeas abre el camino para que avance el acuerdo SUNNYVALE, California y REDMOND, Washington--(Business Wire)-- Microsoft (Nasdaq: MSFT) y Yahoo! (Nasdaq: YHOO) anunciaron hoy que han obtenido autorización para su acuerdo relacionado con las búsquedas, sin restricciones, tanto del Departamento de Justicia de los EE. UU. como de la Comisión Europea, y ahora centrarán su atención en el inicio del proceso de implementación del acuerdo. Se espera que la implementación del acuerdo comience en los próximos días e implicará la transición de las plataformas de búsqueda algorítmica y pagada de Yahoo! a Microsoft, convirtiéndose Yahoo! en la fuerza de ventas exclusiva para los anunciantes premium de ambas compañías a nivel mundial. Una vez se complete la transición, el mercado unificado de búsquedas de las compañías brindará una mayor innovación a los consumidores, mejor eficacia y mayor volumen para los anunciantes, así como más oportunidades de monetización para los editores web por medio de una plataforma que incluye una mayor fuente de consultas de búsqueda. "Esta innovadora alianza de sistemas de búsqueda significa que Yahoo! puede concentrarse aún más en su propia e innovadora experiencia de búsqueda", manifestó Carol Bartz, directora ejecutiva de Yahoo!. "En Yahoo! ahora podemos dedicarnos a lo que mejor hacemos: combinar nuestra ciencia y tecnología con contenidos atractivos para desarrollar experiencias en Internet relevantes a nivel personal para nuestros clientes y usuarios". Steve Ballmer, director ejecutivo de Microsoft, coincidió con la declaración de Bartz. "Aunque hasta ahora nos encontramos en el inicio de este proceso, hemos alcanzado un hito emocionante", expresó Ballmer. "Pienso que en conjunto, Microsoft y Yahoo! promoverán más opciones, mayor valor y más innovación para nuestros clientes y también para los anunciantes y editores". Experiencia de búsqueda del consumidor Según las condiciones del acuerdo, anunciado a fines de julio de 2009, Microsoft proporcionará a Yahoo! las mismas listas de resultados de búsqueda que se encuentran disponibles a través de Bing y, a su vez, Yahoo! innovará en relación a esas listas al combinar listas mejoradas gracias al rico contenido de Yahoo! con información organizada de manera práctica acerca de temas clave y herramientas para personalizar la experiencia de los usuarios de Yahoo!. Yahoo! se concentrará en ofrecer una experiencia de búsqueda innovadora y atractiva que permita que los usuarios exploren y encuentren las cosas, las personas y los sitios que más les interesen. Si bien Microsoft proporcionará la plataforma principal, ambas compañías continuarán creando experiencias diferentes, atractivas y en evolución, y compitiendo por la audiencia, la participación y los clics. Cronograma de la transición Yahoo! y Microsoft trabajarán con anunciantes, editores y desarrolladores siguiendo un plan personalizado, que está diseñado para que la transición sea lo más eficaz posible y sin inconvenientes. Las dos compañías comenzarán a trabajar en estrecha colaboración con la mayoría de los socios con bastante anterioridad a la fecha prevista de transición a la plataforma de Microsoft y comunicarán de manera periódica a los socios información importante acerca de la transición vía telefónica, mediante correo electrónico, seminarios web y un sitio web recientemente creado: www.searchalliance.com. Las compañías comenzarán con la transición de la búsqueda algorítmica y se han fijado la meta de finalizar ese esfuerzo, al menos en los Estados Unidos, a fines del año 2010. Las compañías también esperan haber logrado un progreso importante en cuanto a la transición de anunciantes y editores estadounidenses antes de la temporada de fiestas de 2010, pero posiblemente esperen hasta 2011 si determinan que la transición será más eficaz luego de las fiestas. Se espera que a principios de 2012 ya se haya completado la transición de todos los clientes y socios a nivel mundial. Relaciones con los clientes Una vez que se implemente la transición, cada una de las compañías representará y proporcionará atención al cliente a distintos segmentos de anunciantes. El equipo de ventas de Yahoo! representará y proporcionará soporte de manera exclusiva a los anunciantes de gran volumen, a las agencias de marketing en motores de búsqueda (Search Engine Marketing, SEM) y de optimización de motores de búsqueda (Search Engine Optimization, SEO), a los revendedores y a sus clientes. Microsoft representará y proporcionará soporte a los anunciantes de autoservicio. Resumen normativo Si bien la transacción anteriormente fue autorizada por agencias reguladoras de Australia, Brasil y Canadá, las condiciones del acuerdo requerían el permiso de las agencias reguladoras estadounidenses y europeas antes de que se iniciara. Mientras tanto, Microsoft y Yahoo! continúan trabajando con agencias reguladoras de Corea, Taiwán y Japón para asegurarse de que tienen toda la información relevante necesaria para evaluar la transacción antes de que comience el acuerdo en esas jurisdicciones específicas. Acerca de Microsoft Fundada en 1975, Microsoft (Nasdaq: MSFT) es líder mundial en software, servicios y soluciones que ayudan a las personas y a las empresas a alcanzar su máximo potencial. Nota para los editores: si están interesados en obtener información adicional acerca de Microsoft, visiten la página web de Microsoft en http://www.microsoft.com/presspass en las páginas de información corporativa de Microsoft. Los vínculos en Internet, los números de teléfono y los cargos eran correctos al momento de la publicación, pero pueden haber cambiado desde entonces. Para recibir asistencia adicional, los periodistas y analistas pueden comunicarse con el Equipo de Respuesta Rápida de Microsoft o con otros contactos apropiados relacionados en http://www.microsoft.com/presspass/contactpr.mspx. Acerca de Yahoo! Yahoo! atrae a cientos de millones de usuarios cada mes gracias a su innovadora tecnología y sus atractivos contenidos y servicios, convirtiéndose así en uno de los destinos con más tráfico en Internet y en una de las compañías de medios en línea más reconocidas del mundo. La meta de Yahoo! es convertirse en el centro de la vida en línea de la gente a través de experiencias de Internet útiles y de interés personal para ellos. La sede principal de Yahoo! está ubicada en Sunnyvale, California. Para obtener más información, visite pressroom.yahoo.com o el blog de la compañía, Yodel Anecdotal (yodel.yahoo.com). Este comunicado de prensa contiene declaraciones a futuro con relación a riesgos e incertidumbres con respecto al acuerdo de búsqueda de Yahoo! con Microsoft. Los riesgos potenciales e incertidumbres incluyen, entre otros, que los beneficios esperados del acuerdo con Microsoft no puedan obtenerse, y la respuesta o la aceptación del acuerdo por parte de editores, anunciantes, usuarios y empleados, y socios estratégicos y de negocios de Yahoo! Yahoo! es la marca comercial y/o la marca comercial registrada de Yahoo! Inc.Todos los otros nombres son marcas comerciales y/o marcas comerciales registradas de sus respectivos propietarios. Fotos y galería de multimedia disponibles en: http://www.businesswire.com/cgi-bin/mmg.cgi?eid=6184785=es El texto original en el idioma fuente de este comunicado es la versión oficial autorizada. Las traducciones solo se suministran como adaptación y deben cotejarse con el texto en el idioma fuente, que es la única versión del texto que tendrá un efecto legal. Yahoo! Kim Rubey, 408-349-4040 krubey@yahoo-inc.com o Microsoft (The Glover Park Group) Ben Hammer, 202-295-0143 bhammer@gpgdc.com Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.headline: Western Union to Present at the Goldman Sachs Technology and Internet Conference
entry.body: ENGLEWOOD, Colo.--(Business Wire)-- The Western Union Company (NYSE: WU) announced that the company will present at the Goldman Sachs Technology and Internet Conference on Tuesday, February 23, 2010 in San Francisco. The presentation will begin at 11:40 AM Pacific Time and will include comments from Scott Scheirman, Chief Financial Officer, and Stewart Stockdale, President of the Americas and Executive Vice President of Global Cards and Global Key Accounts. Investors and interested parties will be able to listen to the investor presentation via webcast from www.westernunion.com, under the investor relations section. The archived webcast will be available approximately one hour after the conclusion of the presentation. About Western Union The Western Union Company (NYSE: WU) is a leader in global payment services. Together with its Vigo, Orlandi Valuta, Pago Facil and Custom House branded payment services, Western Union provides consumers and businesses with fast, reliable and convenient ways to send and receive money around the world, as well as send payments and purchase money orders. The Western Union, Vigo and Orlandi Valuta branded services are offered through a combined network of more than 410,000 agent locations in 200 countries and territories. In 2009, The Western Union Company completed 196 million consumer-to-consumer transactions worldwide, moving $71 billion of principal between consumers, and 415 million business payments. For more information, visit www.westernunion.com. WU-F, WU-G Western Union Media Tom Fitzgerald, 720-332-4374 tom.fitzgerald@westernunion.com or Investors Mike Salop, 720-332-8276 mike.salop@westernunion.com Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.headline: Join Wall St. Executives and Members of the International Business Community Including Microsoft, SONY, GE, Dow Jones, Goldman Sachs & Co., Morgan Stanley, JP Morgan Discuss the Future of Mergers and Acquisitions
entry.body: NEW YORK--(Business Wire)-- IQPC announces the International Mergers and Acquisitions Summit being held in New York City, from March 31-April 1st, 2010. The International M Summitwas designed to give you the most up-to-date information on the current international M landscape. Hear cutting-edge strategy from M experts, including: * Marc Brown, Managing Director, Corporate Development, MICROSOFT * Gregg Walker, Senior Vice President of Corporate Development, SONY CORPORATION OF AMERICA * Duncan O`Brien General Manager of Corporate Development, GENERAL ELECTRIC COMPANY * Robert Kindler, Vice Chairman, Global Head of M, MORGAN STANLEY * Andre L. Hidi, Executive Managing Director and Head of M, Global BMO APITAL MARKETS * William D. Anderson Jr., Managing Director, GOLDMAN SACHS & CO. * Gary W. Parr, Deputy Chairman, LAZARD * Anne Caputo, Executive Director, DOW JONES & COMPANY * And Many More! "Over the next 12 months there will be numerous M opportunities for stable corporate and financial acquirers as heavily levered acquisition targets face even greater financial strain. Management teams that remain vigilant about looking outside their organizations for attractive near-term acquisitions could find multiple opportunities to improve and grow their companies." Fred Sagel, M.A., LL.M Conference Director, Finance & Legal IQ About $575 billion worth of deals have been announced in the fourth quarter-and the smart thinking says that number will only increase in 2010. Attend the International M event, to learn: * The latest financial and legal developments in international M * The countries and the sectors where the deals are being made * Innovative alternative financing techniques * The newest opportunities in obtaining bank and private equity financing * The newest dangers in due diligence * How to effectively acquire distressed business For a full list of the speakers and sessions, download the brochure at www.mandasummit.com IQPC (www.iqpc.com) provides business executives with tailored practical conferences, large-scale events, topical seminars and in-house training programs. Producing over 1,500 events annually around the world, IQPC continues to grow and has offices in cities across six continents including: Berlin, Dubai, London, New York, Sao Paulo, Singapore, Stockholm, Sydney, and Toronto. IQPC Kristy Dineen, +1-646-502-3260 www.iqpc.com Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.headline: Charles Schwab rises after Goldman upgrade
entry.body:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Shares of Charles Schwab Corp SCHW.O rose 2.5 percent to $18.25 in premarket trading on Friday after Goldman Sachs upgraded the stock to "neutral" from "sell."

(Reporting by Ryan Vlastelica, Editing by W Simon )

entry.headline: International Rectifier to Present at Goldman Sachs Technology and Internet 2010 Conference
entry.body: EL SEGUNDO, Calif.--(Business Wire)-- International Rectifier Corporation (NYSE:IRF) today announced that Chief Executive Officer Oleg Khaykin and Chief Financial Officer Ilan Daskal will present at the Goldman Sachs Technology and Internet 2010 Conference in San Francisco, California, on Thursday, February 25 at 10:20 a.m. Pacific Time. Khaykin and Daskal will discuss International Rectifier`s business strategy and growth opportunities for its power management technologies across key end market segments. A live audio webcast of the discussion with analysts and investors will be available at International Rectifier`s website: http://investors.irf.com. This event will be webcast in listen-only mode. The webcast will remain available on the company`s website for 30 days. About International Rectifier International Rectifier Corporation (NYSE:IRF) is a world leader in power management technology. IR`s analog, digital, and mixed signal ICs, and other advanced power management products, enable high performance computing and save energy in a wide variety of business and consumer applications. Leading manufacturers of computers, energy efficient appliances, lighting, automobiles, satellites, aircraft, and defense systems rely on IR`s power management solutions to power their next generation products. For more information, go to www.irf.com. International Rectifier Corporation Investors: Chris Toth, 310-252-7731 Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.headline: Parker Waichman Alonso LLP Criticizes Procter & Gamble for Failing to Act on the Serious Health Threat Posed by Zinc-Containing Fixodent Denture Adhesive
entry.body: Procter & Gamble Strongly Urged to Follow GlaxoSmithKline's Example, and Stop the Manufacture, Distribution and Advertising of Fixodent Denture Cream GREAT NECK, N.Y.--(Business Wire)-- The attorneys of Parker Waichman Alonso LLP urge Procter & Gamble to take steps to protect consumers from the serious health risks posed by Fixodent, a denture adhesive that contains zinc. GlaxoSmithKline announced yesterday their decision to voluntarily stop the manufacture, distribution and advertising of three varieties of Super PoliGrip denture adhesive products that are made with zinc. Parker Waichman Alonso LLP has filed numerous lawsuits on behalf of the victims of Fixodent and Super PoliGrip. These lawsuits allege that the manufacturers of these denture creams misled consumers about their risks and failed to provide adequate warnings and instructions to prevent deviation from accepted use. A small amount of zinc is necessary for a balanced diet. However, being exposed to an excessive amount of zinc can result in copper depletion and serious negative adverse neurological effects. In August 2008, the peer reviewed journal "Neurology" reported on four patients suffering from neuropathy and other neurological symptoms typical of zinc poisoning and copper depletion. The article specifically linked excess zinc in denture adhesives to "profound neurologic disease" in the patients reviewed. Despite falling short of a full recall of its product, Parker Waichman Alonso applauds the decision GlaxoSmithKline has finally made to protect the public from zinc-containing Super PoliGrip varieties, even though these actions come too late to help those already afflicted with denture cream zinc poisoning. "While we believe GlaxoSmithKline has made a good decision here, unfortunately it comes too late for some of our clients who have struggled, sometimes for years, trying to find the source of their problems," says Andres Alonso, a partner of Parker Waichman Alonso. "We sincerely hope that GlaxoSmithKline will ultimately issue a full recall of all zinc-containing Super PoliGrip products given their devastating impact on consumers and strongly urge Procter & Gamble to act in a similar fashion to protect the public from the risks posed by Fixodent, the other zinc-containing denture cream on the market." Unfortunately, Procter & Gamble remains silent and has failed to warn its customers about the serious health hazards they face from excessive exposure to the zinc in Fixodent. Procter & Gamble should follow GlaxoSmithKline's example, and immediately take strong steps to address this serious public health threat. Dozens of denture cream zinc poisoning lawsuits have been consolidated in the Denture Cream Products Liability Multidistrict Litigation currently pending in the United States District Court for the Southern District of Florida, Miami Division, before the Honorable Judge Cecilia Altonaga (MDL No. 2051). In an order filed on July 13, 2009, Judge Altonaga appointed Andres F. Alonso Esq., a partner with Parker Waichman Alonso LLP, as Co- Lead Counsel to the Plaintiffs' Steering Committee in the Denture Cream Products Liability Litigation. Parker Waichman Alonso has received thousands of calls from denture cream users and continues to offer free consultations to the victims of denture cream zinc poisoning. If you or a loved one uses or have used Super PoliGrip or Fixodent and now suffer from neurological problems, please contact our office by visiting www.yourlawyer.com. Free case evaluations are also available by calling 1 800 LAW INFO (1-800-529-4636). About Parker Waichman Alonso LLP Parker Waichman Alonso LLP is a leading personal injury law firm that represents plaintiffs nationwide. The firm has offices in New York, New Jersey and Florida. Parker Waichman Alonso LLP has assisted thousands of clients in receiving fair compensation for injuries resulting from defective drugs, medical devices and other products. For more information on Parker Waichman Alonso LLP, please visit: www.yourlawyer.com or call 1-800-LAW-INFO (1-800-529-4636). Parker Waichman Alonso LLP David Krangle, Esq. (800) LAW-INFO (800) 529-4636 www.yourlawyer.net/dc www.yourlawyer.com Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.headline: iSIGN Media Solutions Inc. Announces Two Initiatives With Skipton Group Inc. for Integration With IBM Anyplace(TM)
entry.body: TORONTO, ONTARIO, Feb 19 (MARKET WIRE) -- iSIGN Media Solutions Inc. ("iSIGN" or "Company") (TSX VENTURE: ISD), is pleased to announce that is has partnered with Skipton Group Inc. ("Skipton") on two Original Equipment Manufacturer ("OEM") initiatives for the IBM AnyPlace(TM) Kiosk. As a software solutions partner, iSIGN will license its patent pending interactive proximity messaging solution to Skipton - a Premier IBM Business Partner with expertise in self-service technology solution design, integration and deployment - for the purposes of enhancing two innovative self-service offerings based on IBM's AnyPlace(TM) Kiosk platform. Consumers will soon be able to interact with two new kiosk innovations - a "Digital Greeter", and an Interactive cosmetic try-on tool, dubbed, the 'Virtual Makeover Kiosk'. The Digital Greeter, designed for retail chains to virtually "greet" and communicate with consumers' cell phones, offers loyalty membership coupons and brand advertising at no cost to the consumer. "There is a very high demand for in-store promotional delivery methods that bypass printed leaflets and coupons while capturing consumer responses and participation," states Alex Romanov, iSIGN's Chief Executive Officer. "This Digital Greeter will set the standard for interactive Bluetooth messaging technology with an exclusive host of shopper conveniences and unprecedented access to valuable shopper insight." An innovative hardware enclosure design for the Digital Greeter is in development by one of Canada's most innovative and trusted consumer packaged goods strategy consultants, The Central Group. The Virtual Makeover Kiosk is powered by innovative cosmetic try-on application software. It is designed to provide North America's most prominent cosmetic retailers with an innovative and relevant solution to reach shoppers at the point of purchase in a market worth over $20 billion annually. iSIGN's licensed Bluetooth transmission solution is embedded in the kiosk to deliver user-relevant product offerings and brand-sponsored beauty tips directly to a shopper's mobile phone - providing an opportunity to influence purchase decisions in real time. iSIGN will power their interactive messaging solution on the IBM AnyPlace(TM) Kiosk platform, seen as the industry's most reliable, proven and supported self-service technology solution. Retailers will be introduced to both the Digital Greeter and Virtual Makeover Kiosk at the Digital Signage Expo (DSE) in Las Vegas, booth #1450, February 24-25, 2010. "This route to market - leveraging the contributing partners' complementary skill-sets with IBM's proven technology and iSIGN's innovative approach to reaching consumers - will be an industry first," adds Andy Bruce, Business Development Manager for Skipton Group. "Both kiosks are supported by scalable and customizable software platforms from industry leading independent software vendors." iSIGN is now poised to become a software vendor to several other major enterprises this quarter. SKIPTON GROUP INC. Skipton is a leading provider of information technology infrastructure solutions and an IBM Premier Business Partner. With over eleven years assisting large Canadian Retailers, Skipton is uniquely positioned to provide, install and support state-of-the-art retail software and hardware solutions across North America. Additional information about Skipton can be found at www.skipton.ca. About iSIGN Media iSIGN is a leading developer of location-based interactive proximity advertising solutions that deliver rich media, permission based messages, free of charge to cell phones using Bluetooth connectivity. The Company's patent-pending advertising platform combines the precision of direct marketing and the tracking potential of the Web to deliver more cost effective and ROI-driven advertising than is possible via print, radio and television. iSIGN is based in Markham, Ontario with R and customer support operations in Vancouver, BC. iSIGN is publicly traded in Toronto (TSX.V) under the symbol "ISD". Additional information about iSIGN Media can be found at www.isignmedia.com. Forward-Looking Statements This news release includes certain forward-looking statements that are based upon current expectations, which involve risks and uncertainties associated with iSIGN Media's business and the environment in which the business operates. Any statements contained herein that are not statements of historical facts may be deemed to be forward-looking, including those identified by the expressions "anticipate", "believe", "plan", "estimate", "expect", "intend", and similar expressions to the extent they relate to the Company or its management. The forward-looking statements are not historical facts, but reflect iSIGN Media's current expectations regarding future results or events. entry.author: None
entry.headline: Yahoo! und Microsoft starten Suchallianz
entry.body: Abschluss der behördlichen Prüfung in den USA und Europa ebnet Weg für Kooperation SUNNYVALE, Kalifornien, & REDMOND, Staat Washington (USA)--(Business Wire)-- Microsoft (Nasdaq:MSFT) und Yahoo! (Nasdaq:YHOO) haben heute bekannt gegeben, dass sie sowohl vom US-Justizministerium als auch von der Europäischen Kommission die uneingeschränkte Genehmigung für ihre Kooperation im Bereich der Online-Suche erhalten haben und dass sie nunmehr ihre Aufmerksamkeit der Realisierung der Kooperationsvereinbarung widmen werden. Es wird erwartet, dass die Umsetzung des Vertragsabschlusses in den nächsten Tagen eingeleitet wird. Das bedeutet, dass die algorithmische und kommerzielle Suche von Yahoo! auf die Microsoft-Plattform übergeleitet wird und Yahoo! den Exklusivvertrieb für die Premium-Werbekunden beider Unternehmen weltweit übernehmen wird. Nach Abschluss der Überleitung wird der gemeinsame Suchmarktplatz der Unternehmen durch einen größeren Pool an Suchanfragen viele Vorteile bieten: mehr Innovationen für Verbraucher, höhere Volumina und bessere Effizienz für Werbekunden und bessere Monetarisierungschancen für Web-Publisher. „Diese revolutionäre Suchallianz bedeutet, dass sich Yahoo! zukünftig noch stärker auf seine eigene innovative Suchumgebung konzentrieren kann", erklärt Carol Bartz, Chief Executive Officer von Yahoo!. „Yahoo! kann tun, was das Unternehmen am besten kann: Wir können unser wissenschaftliches und technologisches Können mit attraktiven Inhalten kombinieren, um unseren Nutzern und Kunden persönlich relevante Online-Angebote zur Verfügung zu stellen." Microsoft-CEO Steve Ballmer bekräftigt die Einschätzung von Bartz: „Auch wenn wir erst am Anfang stehen, haben wir bereits jetzt einen interessanten Meilenstein erreicht.Ich bin mir sicher, dass Microsoft und Yahoo! zusammen mehr Vielfalt, größeren Nutzen und ein höheres Maß an Innovationen für unsere Nutzer ebenso wir für unsere Werbekunden und Publisher anbieten können." Suchumgebung für Verbraucher Gemäß den Bedingungen der Vereinbarung, die Ende Juli 2009 angekündigt wurde, wird Microsoft Yahoo! die gleichen Suchergebnislisten zur Verfügung stellen, die auch über Bing verfügbar sind. Yahoo! wird auf diese Listen aufbauend umfangreiche Yahoo!-Inhalte, erweiterte Listen mit passend organisierten Informationen zu Schlüsselthemen und Tools zur individuellen Anpassung der Suchumgebung für die Yahoo!-Nutzer einbinden. Yahoo! wird sich auf das Angebot einer ansprechenden und innovativen Suche konzentrieren, mit deren Hilfe die Nutzer alle jene Dinge, Menschen und Websites finden und erkunden können, die ihnen am wichtigsten sind. Während Microsoft die zugrunde liegende Plattform liefern wird, werden beide Unternehmen weiterhin unterschiedliche, attraktive und sich ständig weiterentwickelnde Umgebungen schaffen und damit um Besucher, Aufträge und Klicks werben. Zeitplan für die Überleitung Yahoo! und Microsoft werden gemeinsam mit Werbekunden, Publishern und Entwicklern einen maßgeschneiderten Plan entwickeln, der eine möglichst effiziente und reibungslose Überleitung gewährleisten soll. Beide Unternehmen werden bereits lange vor der geplanten Überleitung auf die Microsoft-Plattform anfangen, mit den meisten Partnern zusammenzuarbeiten und werden ihren Partnern regelmäßig wichtige Informationen zur Überleitung per Telefon, per E-Mail, in Webinars und auf einer neu geschaffenen Website unter www.searchalliance.com zur Verfügung stellen. Die Unternehmen werden mit der Überleitung der algorithmischen Suche beginnen und haben es sich zum Ziel gesetzt, diese, zumindest in den USA, bis Ende 2010 abgeschlossen zu haben. Ebenso hoffen die Unternehmen, noch vor der Weihnachtssaison 2010 maßgebliche Fortschritte bei der Überleitung der US-Werbekunden und Publisher zu machen, werden aber möglicherweise bis 2011 warten, sollten sie feststellen, dass die Überleitung nach der Weihnachtssaison effektiver sein sollte. Die Überleitung aller Kunden und Partner weltweit soll bis Anfang 2012 abgeschlossen sein. Kundenbeziehungen Nach der Überleitung werden sich Yahoo! und Microsoft jeweils um unterschiedliche Werbekundensegmente kümmern und für diese den Kundendienst anbieten. Das Vertriebsteam von Yahoo! wird ausschließlich Werbe-Großkunden, SEO- und SEM-Agenturen sowie Wiederverkäufer und deren Kunden betreuen. Microsoft wird sich um Selbstbedienungs-Werbekunden kümmern und für diese auch den Kundendienst anbieten. Aufsichtsbehörden - Zusammenfassung Obwohl der Geschäftsabschluss zuvor bereits von den Behörden in Australien, Brasilien und Kanada genehmigt wurde, war gemäß den Bedingungen der Vereinbarung vorher auch noch die Zustimmung der Behörden in den USA und Europa notwendig. Mittlerweile arbeiten Microsoft und Yahoo! weiter mit den Behörden in Korea, Taiwan und Japan zusammen, um sicherzustellen, dass diese über alle relevanten Informationen verfügen, um den Geschäftsabschluss vor dem Start der Kooperation in diesen spezifischen Ländern zu prüfen. Über Microsoft Microsoft (Nasdaq:MSFT) wurde 1975 gegründet und ist der weltweit führende Anbieter in den Bereichen Software, Dienstleistungen und Lösungen, die Einzelpersonen und Unternehmen dabei helfen, ihr volles Potenzial auszuschöpfen. Anmerkungen für Redakteure: Wenn Sie Interesse an zusätzlichen Informationen über Microsoft haben, besuchen Sie bitte die Website von Microsoft unter http://www.microsoft.com/presspass und dort die Seiten mit Unternehmensinformationen zu Microsoft. Internet-Links, Telefonnummern und Titel waren zum Zeitpunkt der Veröffentlichung korrekt, können sich aber seitdem möglicherweise geändert haben. Um weitere Unterstützung zu erhalten, wenden sich Journalisten und Analysten bitte an das Rapid Response Team von Microsoft beziehungsweise andere unter http://www.microsoft.com/presspass/contactpr.mspx aufgeführte geeignete Ansprechpartner. Über Yahoo! Yahoo! zieht durch seine innovative Technologie und seine attraktiven Inhalte und Dienstleistungen jeden Monat Millionen Nutzer an und macht die Yahoo!-Seiten damit zu den am häufigsten angeklickten Internetangeboten und das Unternehmen zu einem Online-Medienunternehmen auf Weltklasseniveau. Yahoo! hat die Vision, durch persönlich relevante, bedeutungsvolle Internetangebote im Zentrum des Online-Lebens der Menschen zu stehen. Yahoo! hat seinen Hauptsitz in Sunnyvale, Kalifornien. Weitere Informationen erhalten Sie unter pressroom.yahoo.com oder im Blog des Unternehmens, Yodel Anecdotal (yodel.yahoo.com). Diese Pressemitteilung enthält zukunftsgerichtete Aussagen zu den Risiken und Ungewissheiten hinsichtlich der Such-Kooperation zwischen Yahoo! und Microsoft. Zu den potenziellen Risiken und Unsicherheiten gehört unter anderem, dass der erwartete Nutzen der Kooperation mit Microsoft nicht eintritt und die Reaktionen auf beziehungsweise die Akzeptanz der Kooperation durch Publisher, Werbekunden, Nutzer und Mitarbeiter sowie strategische Partner und Geschäftspartner von Yahoo!. Yahoo! ist die Marke und/oder eingetragene Marke von Yahoo! Inc.Alle anderen Namen sind Marken und/oder eingetragene Marken ihrer jeweiligen Eigentümer. Fotos/Multimedia-Galerie: http://www.businesswire.com/cgi-bin/mmg.cgi?eid=6184785=de Die Ausgangssprache, in der der Originaltext veröffentlicht wird, ist die offizielle und autorisierte Version. Übersetzungen werden zur besseren Verständigung mitgeliefert. Nur die Sprachversion, die im Original veröffentlicht wurde, ist rechtsgültig. Gleichen Sie deshalb Übersetzungen mit der originalen Sprachversion der Veröffentlichung ab. Yahoo! Kim Rubey, 408-349-4040 krubey@yahoo-inc.com oder Microsoft (The Glover Park Group) Ben Hammer, 202-295-0143 bhammer@gpgdc.com Copyright Business Wire 2010

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Walt Disney World Resort Joins Clean the World in an Innovative Program to Recycle Soap
entry.body: ORLANDO, FL, Feb 21 (MARKET WIRE) -- Walt Disney World Resort hotels are working with Clean the World to recycle all the partially used amenities from their nearly 28,000 Central Florida hotel rooms. Clean the World sanitizes the soap and shampoo that would be discarded and distributes these amenities to people in need around the world. "With the support of Walt Disney World, even more supplies will reach those in desperate need," said Paul Till, co-founder and managing director of Clean the World, who is responsible for recruiting new hotels to join the "Clean the World Hospitality Recycling Program." Through this program, hotels financially contribute a tax-deductible recycling fee in exchange for collection, recycling and free redistribution of partially-used amenities to those suffering due to a lack of available hygiene products. In 2009, Clean the World distributed more than 230 tons of hygiene products to countries worldwide including Haiti, Mexico, Honduras, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Uganda, Mali, Zimbabwe, Swaziland, Mongolia and Romania. By participating in this program, Walt Disney World Resort hotels are showing a commitment to saving lives and protecting the environment. Clean the World in Haiti In the wake of the devastating earthquake in Haiti, Clean the World has stepped up its commitment to provide basic necessities to the impoverished people of the island nation, and has included medical supplies, food, water and other essentials as well. Since January 2010, Clean the World has delivered over 150 tons of supplies directly to Haiti. In 2009, Clean the World delivered 200,000 bars of soap to schools, orphanages, clinics and churches in Cap Haitien, Haiti. Though its Haitian partnerships and distribution network, Clean the World is providing free soap to people in desperate need for proper hygiene. In Haiti alone, 8,000 children die annually from diarrheal disease, which is preventable by up to 62% with proper hand washing. About Clean the World, Inc. An Orlando-based charitable organization, Clean the World, Inc. is committed to the prevention of illness and death caused by acute respiratory infection and diarrheal disease in countries across the globe. In an effort to prevent these needless deaths from occurring, Clean the World collects discarded soap and shampoo from hotels to be recycled and distributes these soap products along with appropriate educational materials to domestic homeless shelters and impoverished people worldwide. In 2009, Clean the World collected, recycled and distributed over 230 tons of soap and other bathroom amenities to impoverished people worldwide. With the donations of these discarded soap and shampoo products, Clean the World is a step closer to reaching their goal of preventing the millions of lives lost each year -- and they're doing it one bar of soap at a time. Clean the World Foundation, Inc. is a non-profit, 501(c)(3) tax-exempt charitable organization. Contact: Peter Olsen Communications Director Clean the World Foundation, Inc. 407-678-9791 Email Contact www.cleantheworld.org Copyright 2010, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Exxon shuts Beaumont, Texas, refinery CDU
entry.body:
HOUSTON Feb 21 (Reuters) - Exxon Mobil Corp's (XOM.N) 344,500 barrel per day (bpd) Beaumont, Texas, refinery shut a crude distillation unit on Friday for planned work, according to a company spokesman.

"Impact to production will be minimal and all customer needs will be met," Exxon spokesman Kevin Allexon said in a statement about the crude unit overhaul, which is expected to last for a "few weeks."

The refinery left a message Friday on a telephone information line for Beaumont residents that the refinery was flaring "due to operating conditions" within the plant. (Reporting by Erwin Seba, editing by Maureen Bavdek)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: Alex Dobuzinskis
entry.headline: Disney takes long view in "Alice" theater dispute
entry.body:
LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Europe's top movie theater chain plans to withdraw from screening the Walt Disney Co's latest film "Alice In Wonderland", escalating a dispute over the U.S. studio's proposal to release the movie's DVD weeks earlier than usual.

But Disney's long-term strategy calls for less reliance on those chains in favor of revenue from Blu-ray video and online distribution, analysts say.

On Monday, less than two weeks before the movie's March 5 debut, exhibitor Odeon UCI Cinemas Group, owned by the London-based private equity firm Terra Firma, said it does not plan to show the movie in its UK, Irish or Italian cinemas because Disney wants to sell the DVD five weeks earlier than usual.

Theater owners worry audiences will skip seeing the movie on the big screen in favor of a shorter wait for the DVD, if Disney moves up its release.

A decade ago, DVDs were typically released six months after a film's theatrical debut. But Hollywood studios have been gradually moving up their DVD releases, to tap those consumers who rarely go to the theater. Disney's move will shrink that time to 12 weeks.

Odeon Cinemas operates 110 theaters in the UK and 22 in Italy.

Negotiations continued this week between Disney and No. 2 U.S. chain AMC Entertainment Inc, which boasts more than 4,500 screens.

Still, analysts said U.S. theater chains are unlikely to boycott en-masse the year's first blockbuster release, wary of the hit to their bottom line -- at least for now.

AMC did not return calls, and Disney declined comment.

"AMC's a major exhibitor chain, obviously that makes a difference, but my guess is this (dispute) will be settled close to the opening-day release," said analyst Hal Vogel of Vogel Capital Management.

"Disney understands the implications of what they're doing," Vogel said. "They're looking to the long-term future, and the long-term future is less reliance on theaters and more reliance on new technology."

That new technology involves getting movies into homes through Blu-ray discs, as well as other delivery methods such as video-on-demand.

"Theaters are obviously very important still, and any distribution company would be foolish to upset the relationships to any great degree," Vogel said.

(Editing by Edwin Chan)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Google, Microsoft and Apple: Which one will thrive?
entry.body:
Apple, Google and Microsoft are locked in a three-way struggle for industry dominance, competing to varying degrees on hardware, computer and cell phone operating systems, applications, entertainment, Internet search and more.

Today, Google owns Internet search, Microsoft owns operating systems and applications, and Apple owns high-end hardware and entertainment and media devices. That may well change, though. So it's worthwhile to ask: As each company looks to encroach on the turf of the others, which one is best positioned for the future -- and which is most likely to fall?

Although Apple is riding high now, it's the most vulnerable of the three. That's because its success is built on the singular vision and talent of one person -- Steve Jobs.

In plenty of companies, if someone else took the place of an existing CEO, the company would do just about as well. That's not the case with Apple and Jobs, though -- for all intents and purposes, he is Apple. Before he returned to Apple in 1996, the company was floundering. He killed money-losing projects like the Newton; oversaw the creation of a host of innovative products, including Mac OS X, the iPod, the iPhone and the iMac; and rejuvenated the company. Harvard Business Review last year named him the most valuable CEO in the world, because under his leadership, Apple's market value increased by approximately $150 billion, delivering a 3,188% industry-adjusted return.

That's both the good news and the bad news for Apple. As long as Jobs is on the job, great. But he won't be CEO forever, and there's no heir apparent who can match his vision. My guess is that after he leaves, Apple will experience a long, slow decline.

Apple, far more than Microsoft or Google, has a business model somewhat akin to that of a Hollywood studio: It requires blockbuster hits in order to bring in big profits. When Jobs leaves, those hits will stop coming.

Of the three companies, Google is best positioned to thrive in the future. It has a near monopoly on Internet search, the core of the world economy's greatest growth engine. That gives it both an excellent base to expand upon, as well as a massive war chest it can depend on to fund new ventures. Although at times Google takes a scattershot approach to product development, it has heavily targeted high-growth areas as well, notably mobile devices. Because of that, it is well positioned to take advantage of the mobile device advertising boom that is likely to develop in the coming years. And although Google isn't likely to compete seriously against Microsoft in the operating systems and applications markets, it will gain enough revenue from its offerings to make it a player in those businesses.

Finally, there's Microsoft, which falls somewhere between Apple and Google. Unlike Apple, it doesn't need big hits in order to grow. With a stranglehold on operating systems and productivity applications, and with solid enterprise tools, it will grow steadily. Google won't be able to break its near monopoly.

The success of Windows 7 shows that the release of a new operating system still brings in plenty of revenue. Recently, Microsoft had a blowout quarter, increasing revenue by 14% over the year-earlier period, thanks to skyrocketing Windows 7 sales. And although Microsoft won't unseat Google as the Internet search leader, Bing shows that it can make plenty of money in that business.

So looking ahead, expect Google to thrive, Microsoft to stay the course, and Apple eventually to lose its Jobs-driven magic.

Preston Gralla is a contributing editor for Computerworld.com and the author of more than 35 books, including How the Internet Works (Que, 2006).

Read more about management in Computerworld's Management Knowledge Center.

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Microsoft, Amazon sign patent deal
entry.body:
SEATTLE (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp said on Monday it signed a patent agreement with Amazon.com Inc that allows the two companies to share technology in several areas including Amazon's Kindle electronic book reader and Amazon's use of Linux-based servers.

The companies did not disclose details, but Microsoft said Amazon would pay it an undisclosed amount under the patent license agreement.

(Reporting by Bill Rigby; Editing by Gary Hill)

FILED UNDER:

entry.headline: Disney takes long view in "Alice" theater dispute
entry.body:

* Short run for "Alice In Wonderland" upsets exhibitors

* UK's Odeon Cinemas plans to boycott movie

entry.headline: D.R. Horton, Inc. Presentation at the J. P. Morgan Global High Yield and Leveraged...
entry.body: D.R. Horton, Inc. Presentation at the J. P. Morgan Global High Yield and Leveraged Finance Conference to be Webcast Live March 2, 2010 FORT WORTH, Texas, Feb. 22, 2010 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- D.R. Horton, Inc. (NYSE:DHI), America's Builder, today announced that the Company will make a presentation to the investment community via webcast at the J. P. Morgan Global High Yield and Leveraged Finance Conference on Tuesday, March 2, 2010 at 11:45 a.m. ET. The presentation may be accessed through the Investor Relations page of the D.R. Horton website at www.drhorton.com. Listeners are encouraged to go to the site at least five minutes before the scheduled presentation time. A replay of the presentation will be available within 24 hours of the presentation and may be accessed until March 16, 2010. D.R. Horton, Inc., America's Builder, is the largest homebuilder in the United States, based on its 18,164 homes closed in the twelve-month period ended December 31, 2009. Founded in 1978 in Fort Worth, Texas, D.R. Horton has operations in 73 markets in 26 states in the East, Midwest, Southeast, South Central, Southwest and West regions of the United States. The Company is engaged in the construction and sale of high quality homes with sales prices ranging from $90,000 to over $700,000. D.R. Horton also provides mortgage financing and title services for homebuyers through its mortgage and title subsidiaries. The D.R. Horton, Inc. logo is available at http://www.globenewswire.com/newsroom/prs/?pkgid=4317 CONTACT: D.R. Horton, Inc. entry.headline: InfoSpace to Present at the Goldman Sachs Technology and Internet Conference
entry.body: BELLEVUE, Wash.--(Business Wire)-- InfoSpace, Inc. (NASDAQ:INSP) today announced that William Lansing, president and chief executive officer, and David Binder, chief financial officer, will participate in a question and answer session at the Goldman Sachs Technology and Internet Conference. The session is scheduled to begin at 4 p.m. PT / 7 p.m. ET on Tuesday, February 23, 2010. A live audio webcast of the presentation will be available under the Events section of the InfoSpace corporate Web site, at www.infospaceinc.com. About InfoSpace, Inc. InfoSpace, Inc., a leading developer of metasearch products, is focused on bringing the best of the Web to Internet users. InfoSpace's proprietary metasearch technology combines the top results from several of the largest online search engines, providing fast and comprehensive search results. InfoSpace sites include Dogpile (www.dogpile.com), DoGreatGood (www.dogreatgood.com), InfoSpace.com (www.infospace.com), MetaCrawler (www.metacrawler.com), WebCrawler (www.webcrawler.com), and WebFetch (www.webfetch.com). InfoSpace's metasearch technology is also available on nearly 100 partner sites, including content, community, and connectivity sites. In addition to the Company`s metasearch offerings, InfoSpace operates Haggle (www.haggle.com), a competitive shopping site. More information may be found at www.infospaceinc.com. InfoSpace.com, InfoSpace, Dogpile, DoGreatGood, MetaCrawler, WebCrawler, WebFetch, Haggle, and other marks are trademarks of InfoSpace, Inc.The names of other companies and products mentioned herein may be the trademarks of their respective owners. entry.author: None
entry.headline: IBM, Johnson Controls partner on green buildings
entry.body:
SAN FRANCISCO Feb 22 (Reuters) - Technology giant IBM (IBM.N) is expanding its green business by partnering with Johnson Controls Inc (JCI.N) to offer services that will help in cutting energy and water use in buildings.

The two companies said on Monday that they have launched an initiative that combines IBM's business analytics software with Johnson Controls' building and energy efficiency tools.

Currently about 40 percent of U.S. energy use goes toward the heating, cooling and general operation of buildings.

IBM estimates that the information technology part of the green buildings market will grow from $3 billion in 2010 to $6 billion or more in 2015, Rich Lechner, IBM's vice president of energy environment, said in an interview.

"There is a huge opportunity in retrofitting buildings," he said.

Also, more incentives are being offered worldwide by governments and utilities to encourage energy efficiency.

"Over 200 incentives across the United States are being offered, which can have a substantive impact in terms of reducing the cost of the investment," Lechner said. "The opportunity is anywhere from 30 percent to 40 percent reduction in energy usage." (Reporting by Poornima Gupta; Editing by Gary Hill)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: W. P. Carey Acquires JPMorgan Chase Facility
entry.body: NEW YORK, NY, Feb 22 (MARKET WIRE) -- Investment firm W. P. Carey & Co. LLC (NYSE: WPC) announced today that it has purchased the JPMorgan Chase Operations Center office building from Brookfield Real Estate Opportunity Group, an affiliate of Brookfield Asset Management. Located in the CentrePort Business Park two miles south of the Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport and equidistant from the Dallas Central Business District and downtown Fort Worth, the 386,000 square foot facility is leased to JPMorgan Chase Bank, National Association under a long term lease. The purchase was completed in conjunction with the recently announced closing of Brookfield's acquisition of a 16 property, 2.9 million square foot building portfolio from JPMorgan Chase. Commenting on the acquisition, W. P. Carey President and CEO Gordon DuGan noted, "The acquisition of the JP Morgan Chase facility adds a well-located, quality property leased to a premier tenant to our public company property portfolio. This investment extends the average lease term for the portfolio and replaces real estate revenue from assets sold over the last year. As real estate owned is an important segment of adjusted cash flow, which in turn is a key metric for determining our dividend distributions, we are pleased to add this property to the public company property portfolio." Steve Ganeless, Senior Vice President of Brookfield Real Estate Opportunity Fund, noted, "Working with W. P. Carey on the sale of the Dallas facility enabled us to streamline the legal and funding processes by closing our purchase of the larger portfolio and the sale of the operations center the same day." W. P. Carey & Co. LLC W. P. Carey & Co. LLC (NYSE: WPC) is an investment management company that provides long-term sale-leaseback and build-to-suit financing for companies worldwide and manages a global investment portfolio approaching $10 billion. Through its CPA(R) series of income-generating, non-traded REITs, W. P. Carey helps companies and private equity firms unlock capital tied up in real estate assets. The W. P. Carey Group's investments are highly diversified, comprising contractual agreements with approximately 300 long-term corporate obligors spanning 28 industries and 15 countries. http://www.wpcarey.com This press release contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Federal securities laws. A number of factors could cause the Company's actual results, performance or achievement to differ materially from those anticipated. Among those risks, trends and uncertainties are the general economic climate; the supply of and demand for office and industrial properties; interest rate levels; the availability of financing; and other risks associated with the acquisition and ownership of properties, including risks that the tenants will not pay rent, or that costs may be greater than anticipated. For further information on factors that could impact the Company, reference is made to the Company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission. COMPANY CONTACT: Kristina McMenamin W. P. entry.author: Douwe Miedema
entry.headline: Greece trades should have been less opaque: Goldman
entry.body:
LONDON (Reuters) - Past deals by Greece and others to massage public deficits lacked transparency, a senior Goldman Sachs banker said, the first time it talked openly about financial instruments it and other banks sold.

Currency swaps entered into by his bank and Greece helped reduce that country's budget deficit, but the instruments were not uncommon at the time and there was nothing inappropriate about them, the banker told British lawmakers on Monday.

"With the benefit of hindsight ... in the particular cases going back to the late 1990s and early 2000s ... the standards of transparency could have been and probably should have been higher," Goldman Sachs managing director Gerald Corrigan told a parliamentary committee in a public hearing.

Separately on Monday, Goldman detailed cross-currency derivatives it conducted for Greece in 2001, which reduced the country's debt at a time it was keen to meet criteria for entering the euro.

The nine-year old swaps have re-emerged after several months of concern about Greece's budget and debt levels. But financial market participants have always known about them, and several publications reported about them at the time.

"Those transactions were very much consistent with and comparable with the standard of behavior and measures used by the European Community. There was nothing inappropriate," he said, adding many other banks provided similar other instruments to other countries.

The deal with Greece did "produce a rather small but nevertheless not insignificant reduction in Greece's debt to GDP ratios at that time," said Corrigan, a former president of the U.S. Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

Goldman has borne the brunt of public anger over gold-plated banker pay packages, not helped by comment such as chief executive Lloyd Blankfein's assertion the bank was doing "God's work" in an interview in November.

"Goldman Sachs has been disproportionately singled out," Corrigan said. "I don't think it's unfair ... It's perfectly understandable that people are angry."

Corrigan is a member of the Group of Thirty, a non-profit organization of bankers, financial regulators and academics chaired by Paul Volcker, the former Fed chairman who is now a top economic advisor to President Barack Obama.

Obama shocked markets in January with a crackdown on banks' risk taking, proposing to limit proprietary trading -- or buying and selling of investments for their own accounts -- and exposure to hedge funds and private equity business.

The risks of new market upheavel remained, Corrigan said, despite the fact banks were now much safer than before the crisis, when looking at metrics such as capital, leverage ratios, and excess liquidity.

"I do have some concerns that if we are not very careful at some point we could see animal spirits beginning to pop up here and there again. We have to be much more aggressive and vigilant in the future than in the past," he said.

(Editing by Dan Lalor)

entry.headline: PGi Enhances Web Conferencing Portfolio with IBM LotusLive Meetings
entry.body: LotusLive Meetings Now Available Integrated with PGi`s Award-Winning Audio Services ATLANTA--(Business Wire)-- PGi (NYSE: PGI), a leading provider of meeting and collaboration solutions, today announced the addition of LotusLive Meetings to its portfolio of online meeting solutions. The new offering provides an innovative conferencing and collaboration option for its clients, enabling users to take advantage of PGi`s award-winning audio service integrated into LotusLive Meetings. "PGi's goal is to make meaningful connections easier and more engaging for our clients, and the addition of LotusLive Meetings will help ensure we continue doing just that," said David Guthrie, chief technology officer, PGi. "Twelve million people turn to PGi every month to collaborate, and the addition of dynamic and effective Web conferencing products like LotusLive Meetings allow us to provide the broadest suite of online meeting tools in the marketplace." IBM`s LotusLive Meetings is a full-featured, easy-to-use, Web meetings service that enables users to quickly and confidently share information, give presentations and demonstrate software in a security-rich environment. With integrated audio from PGi into LotusLive Meetings, users can attend a Web meeting and enjoy the benefits of an in-person meeting even when participants are in remote settings. In addition, the audio portion of the meeting can be simply managed directly from the LotusLive Meetings interface. "IBM is excited to welcome PGi to the rapidly expanding LotusLive Partner Community designed for business," said Sean Poulley, IBM vice president of cloud collaboration. "LotusLive and PGi together offer customers a more audience-friendly, Web 2.0 way of delivering an integrated audio and web conference. This combination gives customers greater ease of use, easier access and faster adoption compared with existing online services, all to help customers reduce travel costs immediately." About PGi The world collaborates with PGi. Our advanced meeting, conferencing and collaboration solutions energize people and organizations to connect more meaningfully and work together more productively. Our customers include more than 50,000 companies and nearly 90% of the Fortune 500. Every month, 12 million people around the world use PGi`s advanced solutions and next-generation platform to meet, work and collaborate. PGi is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia with operations in 24 countries worldwide. You can learn more at www.pgi.com. Forward-looking and cautionary statement Statements made in this press release, other than those concerning historical information, should be considered forward-looking and subject to various risks and uncertainties. Such forward-looking statements are made pursuant to the "safe harbor" provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 and are made based on management`s current expectations or beliefs as well as assumptions made by, and information currently available to, management. A variety of factors could cause actual results to differ materially from those anticipated in Premiere Global Services, Inc.`s forward-looking statements, including, but not limited to, the following factors: competitive pressures, including pricing pressures; technological changes; the development of alternatives to our services; general domestic and international economic, business or political conditions; weakening global economic and credit conditions, including customer consolidations, restructuring, bankruptcies or payment defaults; market acceptance of our new services and enhancements; our ability to complete acquisitions and integrate acquired operations; concerns regarding the security of sending information over the Internet and public networks; our ability to upgrade our equipment or increase our network capacity; service interruptions; continued weakness in our legacy broadcast fax business; our dependence on telecommunications supply agreements; increased financial leverage; our dependence on our subsidiaries for cash flow; future write-downs of goodwill or other intangible assets; assessments of income, sales and other taxes for which we have not accrued; our ability to protect our proprietary technology and intellectual property rights; possible adverse results of pending or future litigation or infringement claims; federal or state legislative or regulatory changes, including further government regulations applicable to traditional telecommunications service providers; risks associated with international operations and fluctuations in currency exchange rates; changes in and the successful execution of restructuring and cost reduction initiatives and the market reaction thereto and other factors described from time to time in our press releases, reports and other filings with the SEC, including but not limited to the "Risk Factors" sections of our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2008 and our Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the quarter ended June 30, 2009. All forward-looking statements attributable to us or a person acting on our behalf are expressly qualified in their entirety by this cautionary statement. entry.author: None
entry.headline: Ecuadorean judge changed on Chevron pollution case
entry.body:
QUITO (Reuters) - The provincial court in Ecuador's Amazon region that is hearing a $27 billion environmental damages case against Chevron Corp has changed the judge in charge of the case, court officials said on Monday.

The change was described as an administrative matter not expected to impact the outcome of the case.

Leonardo Ordonez, the newly named president of Sucumbios provincial court, was named to replace outgoing court president Nicolas Zambrano. Local law says the court's chief judge must hear environmental damages cases in the northern province.

"I see no problem with Ordonez continuing the process," plaintiffs' lawyer Pablo Fajardo told Reuters.

"It is an administrative matter, a routine rotation of the presidency of the Sucumbios provincial court," said Chevron spokesman James Craig. "On the face of it, it should not have any impact on Chevron's case."

Zambrano took over the case last year when the previous judge, Juan Nunez, stepped down after he was secretly taped discussing the suit with two mysterious men who recorded the conversation with secret cameras stuck inside a wristwatch and a pen.

Plaintiffs accuse Texaco, which was bought by Chevron in 2001, of polluting the Amazon with faulting drilling practices in the 1970s and 1980s. Chevron denies the accusations.

Ecuador's leftist leader Rafael Correa has said publicly that he sides with the plaintiffs, sparking charges by Chevron of government interference in the case. The initial ruling is expected by both sides to go against Chevron.

But the company vows to appeal any decision for the plaintiffs, ensuring the case will probably stretch for years more.

(Reporting by Alexandra Valencia, editing by Gerald E. McCormick)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Greece trades should have been less opaque: Goldman
entry.body:
LONDON (Reuters) - The transparency of financial instruments used by investment banks and governments to mask budget deficits in the past should have been better, a director at Goldman Sachs (GS.N) said on Monday.

Goldman Sachs Managing Director Gerald Corrigan, a former president of the U.S. Federal Reserve Bank of New York, said currency swaps entered into by his bank and Greece helped reduce that country's budget deficit, but the instruments were not uncommon at the time.

"With the benefit of hindsight ... in the particular cases going back to the late 1990s and early 2000s that the standards of transparency could have been and probably should have been higher," Corrigan told a panel of UK lawmakers.

Goldman earlier on Monday defended the cross-currency derivatives it conducted for Greece in 2001, which reduced the country's debt.

The nine-year old swaps have re-emerged after several months of concern about Greece's budget and debt levels.

"It is true that a family of currency swaps that were entered into jointly by Goldman Sachs and Greece in the late 1990s and early part of 2000s were of a nature that they did produce a rather small but nevertheless not insignificant reduction in Greece's debt to GDP ratios at that time," Corrigan said.

But he said the transactions were consistent with and comparable with the standard of behavior and measure used in Europe at the time.

"There was nothing inappropriate," he said.

(Reporting by Douwe Miedema and Steve Slater)

FILED UNDER:

entry.headline: Goldman Sachs Foundation Investment Yields High ROI
entry.body: PRINCETON, NJ, Feb 22 (MARKET WIRE) -- A new report prepared by Educational Testing Service (ETS) concludes that historically the Goldman Sachs Foundation (GSF) invested in highly effective educational, leadership development, and entrepreneurial programs for high-potential, but disadvantaged youth. ETS calculates return on GSF's investment as $15 for each dollar it invested over the course of its decade-long program. Developing High-Potential Youth Program: A Return on Investment Study for U.S. Programs, examines the work of the GSF's U.S. grantees in their Developing High-Potential Youth Program. Highlights of the report include the evaluation of prominent activities, outcomes, value and impact of seven grantees who have helped young people gain admission to, and succeed at, the most selective colleges and universities in the United States. "The GSF has established a strong track record of generating a clear ROI," explains Dr. Catherine Millett, ETS Senior Research Scientist. "We found that students who participated in each of the seven programs have higher rates of applying to, enrolling and succeeding at selective colleges and universities than their peers. The programs that work with high-potential youth to help them access the top universities not only are needed, but incredibly effective." In the report, Millett and co-author Dr. Michael Nettles, ETS Senior Vice President, conclude that GSF has made enormous contributions to strengthening programs that support high-potential youth who are economically disadvantaged and in great need of support; inventing models that can be replicated to increase the college preparation and achievement of high-potential youth; increasing the earnings of individuals over what they would have earned without the support; and expanding the pool of underrepresented students in both selective colleges and universities, and subsequently in prestigious work environments. The complete report shares insights from a university president, a program director, a current student and a college graduate into what the Developing High-Potential Youth Program has meant to them. Download, Developing High-Potential Youth Program: A Return on Investment Study for U.S. Programs for free. About ETS At nonprofit ETS, we advance quality and equity in education for people worldwide by creating assessments based on rigorous research. ETS serves individuals, educational institutions and government agencies by providing customized solutions for teacher certification, English-language learning, and elementary, secondary and post-secondary education, as well as conducting education research, analysis and policy studies. Founded in 1947, ETS develops, administers and scores more than 50 million tests annually -- including the TOEFL(R) and TOEIC(R) tests, the GRE(R) test and The Praxis Series(TM) assessments -- in more than 180 countries, at over 9,000 locations worldwide. www.ets.org Contact: Jason Baran (609) 683-2428 jbaran@ets.org Copyright 2010, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-
